revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 06:26:58.000000000', 'message': "Correctly mocking builtin open in test_v1_shell

There's now a seperate module 'builtins' from python-future(this package
is now installed by stestr, and stestr in required by oslotest-3.6.0),
so under Python 2.x 'builtins' is also imported as a module and
'bultins.open' is mocked instead of '__builtin__.open'. And according to
the Mock document, we should always patch the object where it's looked
up, so only necessary mocking is made in this patch.

Change-Id: I57ea61cefd3b01b19475b0fa7e16f716eaaa14e6
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly mocking builtin open in test_v1_shell

There's now a seperate module 'builtins' from python-future(this package
is now installed by stestr, and stestr in required by oslotest-3.6.0),
so under Python 2.x 'builtins' is also imported as a module and
'bultins.open' is mocked instead of '__builtin__.open'. And according to
the Mock document, we should always patch the object where it's looked
up, so only necessary mocking is made in this patch.

Change-Id: I57ea61cefd3b01b19475b0fa7e16f716eaaa14e6
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

subject: Keep timestamp field
messages:
[{'account_id': 11827, 'date': '2018-07-10 20:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-07-11 05:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-07-11 08:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Since we extract the timestamp to the 'Timestamp' field, if we accept this change we will have two timestamps in many cases. For example:

"Timestamp":"2018-07-11 09:22:43.949","Hostname":"old_rusty","Pid":"23","tag":"op
enstack_python","programname":"nova-api","timestamp":"2018-07-11 09:22:43 +0100"

Stanislaw: Do you have examples of logs when you have missing timestamps? I wonder if there is a deeper issue with extracting timestamps in those logs. If they are not Kolla logs, I think this change would be better implemented as custom configuration?'}, {'account_id': 11827, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey Doug. Sure I have an example. Let's look on it - there is typical kolla-ansible output of fluentd forwarder:

{"Pid":"35","log_level":"DEBUG","python_module":"neutron_lib.callbacks.manager","request_id":"0ad17862-fef4-490f-9ee6-e7ec2eef7839","user_id":"-","tenant_id":"-","domain_id":"-","user_domain":"-","project_domain":"-","Payload":"Notify callbacks ['neutron.services.segments.db._update_segment_host_mapping_for_agent-8737037038928'] for agent, after_update _notify_loop /var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/neutron_lib/callbacks/manager.py:167","Hostname":"n3plztcldm01.prod.dc3.host","Logger":"openstack.neutron","programname":"neutron-server","dc":"","prnm":"openstack","env":"prod","tags":"zt"}

we've just added couple fields here (but we never deleted any). So you can see that original `Timestamp` field is not here already. That's cause `time_key` **removes** original field by default, just as parser plugins and other ones in fluentd. So when you're setting `time_key blahblahblah` in your input plugin you automatically cut out `blahblahblah` field from output - it moves to `@timestamp` field which is outside `source` body. If in this case you don't just send your logs right to ElasticSearch but trying to aggregate it on different Fluentd forwarder - it will automatically overwrite `@timestamp` field to the time when it will get this message. Thus you will lose original timestamp. You can check that case manually - just deploy kolla-ansible and try to move your fluentd output to file instead of ElasticSearch by default - you'll see that there is no `Timestamp` field in messages bodies.'}, {'account_id': 11827, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:13:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Btw I spent some time searching why it's actually happens and found some mentions about such behavior in documentation of Fluentd v0.10: https://docs.fluentd.org/v0.10/articles/in_tail (grep by keep_time_key). Unfortunately I see that this mention was removed from next versions of Fluentd docs, but there are bugs about that behavior which points that it still works: https://github.com/fluent/fluentd/issues/1360 and you can also see that in parser plugin code https://github.com/fluent/fluentd/blob/66158aa471af8aac9d7e3d045fcf1e1c99b35b2c/lib/fluent/plugin/parser.rb#L98-L104 which used as a mixin for in_tail plugin."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:15:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Thanks for explaining Stanislaw - that makes sense. Have you seen this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550151/ ? It will allow you to customise the Fluentd input file for your use-case. I wonder if that would be a neater solution, as not everyone needs to retain the original Timestamp field. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-07-11 15:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11827, 'date': '2018-07-11 18:26:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Doug, thanks for the link. I believe that customize input overall is a pretty good idea but:

1. I see some discussion there so I don't know if that review will be merged
2. I actually think that it's a good idea to ensure that you have proper log time in every situation (if one doesn't delete that field explicitly), so keeping timestamp looks right to me.

Anyway - I just used to upstream my own downstream changes, so it's up to you guys if it worth to be merged (I hope it is :smile:)."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-12 07:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 20:35:41.000000000', 'message': 'Keep timestamp field

There are cases when we can lost original timestamp field given from
logs, like when we send our logs to the next fluentd forwarder in chain
of forwarders, it will rewrite our timestamp by default. Save
`Timestamp` field explicitly to avoid such situation and be able to
reconstruct messages date and time.

Closes-Bug: #1781046
Change-Id: I2b4486aedacbe16dc4c0fb2e4e4984bd80e59f2d
'}]
commit_message:
Keep timestamp field

There are cases when we can lost original timestamp field given from
logs, like when we send our logs to the next fluentd forwarder in chain
of forwarders, it will rewrite our timestamp by default. Save
`Timestamp` field explicitly to avoid such situation and be able to
reconstruct messages date and time.

Closes-Bug: #1781046
Change-Id: I2b4486aedacbe16dc4c0fb2e4e4984bd80e59f2d

commit_message:
Trigger bifrost CI job on changes and periodically

Use Zuul's filtering mechanisms to only run the bifrost CI job in the
check pipeline when changes are made to the bifrost role. This should
reduce load on the CI system.

Also adds a periodic pipeline containing the bifrost job.

Change-Id: Ie7293d40616c91d2376f4cc85a8e87a130607d99

commit_message:
Armada check: Add test directive to charts

This adds support for executing helm tests via the armada test
directive. It enables theses tests for all services, except for
nova and neutron as executing tests with armada force a chart to
wait. Forcing nova and neutron to wait effectively sequences the
charts, which will result in a failure to deploy past those
services

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581148

Change-Id: I6ac845c82d744e2f5fd79c3e2ff3c1479dd1ddab

[{'created': '2018-07-05 07:22:00.000000000', 'message': 'Wrong error message

Error message while passing more than one value to column name or
number always says "two values for column name/number provided",
even if more than two values are passed.
This PS changes message to "multiple values were provided".

Change-Id: I3ccb76c2ab447b6aaeca084a1f9d00a5e7a459d0
Closes-Bug: #1756789

commit_message:
Wrong error message

Error message while passing more than one value to column name or
number always says "two values for column name/number provided",
even if more than two values are passed.
This PS changes message to "multiple values were provided".

Change-Id: I3ccb76c2ab447b6aaeca084a1f9d00a5e7a459d0
Closes-Bug: #1756789

[{'created': '2018-07-05 14:28:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove oslo.log dependecies

Change-Id: Ibcede5c527ce1b19bc32d2defd9aa489ae133157
'}, {'created': '2018-07-05 14:39:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove oslo.log dependency

oslo.log is a unified way for setting up logging for OpenStack services.
It contains a lot of helpers, integration with oslo_config, etc.

Since rally framework is not service itself, most of 99% of oslo.log is
not used at all.
To reduce the number od dependencies and to increase control of logging,
let's configure logging library without any additional layers

Details:
- Remove all logging options which were not used.
- Add "log_color" option to enable colors in logging messages
  (Defaults to True)
- Put all configuration of logging at rally.common.logging module
- Remove re-setting of logging levels of different third-party libraries
  from rally.api module and add this logic to setup method of logging.
- Simplify interfaces of logging configuration to do not include project
  version and names. It were not used anywhere.

Change-Id: Ibcede5c527ce1b19bc32d2defd9aa489ae133157

commit_message:
Remove oslo.log dependency

oslo.log is a unified way for setting up logging for OpenStack services.
It contains a lot of helpers, integration with oslo_config, etc.

Since rally framework is not service itself, most of 99% of oslo.log is
not used at all.
To reduce the number od dependencies and to increase control of logging,
let's configure logging library without any additional layers

Details:
- Remove all logging options which were not used.
- Add "log_color" option to enable colors in logging messages
  (Defaults to True)
- Put all configuration of logging at rally.common.logging module
- Remove re-setting of logging levels of different third-party libraries
  from rally.api module and add this logic to setup method of logging.
- Simplify interfaces of logging configuration to do not include project
  version and names. It were not used anywhere.

Change-Id: Ibcede5c527ce1b19bc32d2defd9aa489ae133157

commit_message:
Retry yum/zypper package installs

Much like with apt installs, sometimes trying to install remote packages
will fail due to transient errors. We should also do retries with yum and
zypper to improve the success rate.

Change-Id: I94c28814ca0157cc1e592148ccd814f5b5d50814

subject: Fix minor typo in Rally Plugins doc
messages:
[{'account_id': 28569, 'date': '2018-07-11 04:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-07-11 04:27:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-07-11 06:36:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hello Yi Yang,

I noticed you had submitted your first patch to OpenStack! Congratulations! I just wanted to reach out and follow up with you on the comments on your patch to see if you need any help. We want to help you get your patch merged and help you be successful in our community!

I'll add a rally developer to this review to make sure it's seen and help get things moving. 

Please let us know if you have any questions about your patch, the review process, or the community itself. 

Hope to hear from you soon, 

Matt and the rest of the First Contact SIG"}, {'account_id': 28569, 'date': '2018-07-12 01:24:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Matthew. I've just migrated from previous rally to new rally-openstack after the recent release and plan to leverage the verifier plugin interface to integrate additional tests we need in our shop. The change is very minor typo in the plugins doc and I submitted patch to get familiar with the dev process. Please let me know if this self-review comment would meet that requirement for workflow label. Thanks a lot for the welcoming reply."}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-07-12 06:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks!'}]

commit_message:
delete_trust failure will not block a stack delete

Deleting a tenant that has active stacks would have to issue
a stack delete twice per stack to delete those stacks,
that was because the delete_trust would fail, but credentials were still
cleared.This change just logs the error but does not fail the stack delete.

Change-Id: I9d770a91b20d1db137b3fc313c794fcee4a5e4bf
Story: 2002619

What about backward compatibility?
Users may assume the old ETag behavior.
Also, this only solves the problem for new objects, whereas existing objects will show the manifest ETag, instead of the SLO ETag.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2016-07-06 17:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not terribly worried about the upgrade behavior, as the client can neither predict the manifest ETag during object PUT, nor determine an expected ETag from a local file. Basically, if they're trying to use container listings to track changes, they'd need to record whatever the container server sends somewhere anyway.

I added a note in the commit message about how pre-existing SLOs will still exhibit the old behavior."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2016-07-06 17:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2016-07-06 17:43:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Can we open a bug on this to discuss the impact?  I'm not entirely sure this is consistent with how we've handled client perceptible changes in the past...

You make a fairly convincing argument that there is little or no client harm, and the benefit of being able to predict the ETag of a GET seems useful...  I think it's worth some consideration, it's not immediately obvious to me that having two different things stored for old and new manifests is best end state... 

Is there any other options doing something in the object auditor or v2 api?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-06 18:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-02 01:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-21 00:28:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

The only reservation I have here is the conflation of quoted-etag with SLO. Yes, it's true today, but it'd be much nicer IMO to have some explicit flag.

I'm not saying we'll get another large-object type (please, no more), but it could happen that some new thing ends up with quoted etags inadvertently and thus confuses any code expecting SLO manifests.

Still, I don't have anything like that in mind, so I think this is probably a good idea, and we can revisit the explicit flag for new-thing later when we add new-thing."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-06-21 04:04:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

should this have some docs?  i'm not clear on when I should expect an object GET with ?multipart-manifest=get to return an object who's etag and md5 match the listing... something about... quotes?"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-21 17:45:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I looked through our docs, and I don't see a spot where we ever say SLOs' ETags *don't* match between the container and the object. I think it's just an unpleasant thing we let users discover the hard way."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-06-26 18:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

Timur has also noted that it makes life better going forward in 1space for basically the same reason "dealing with s3"

It's not clear to me that either of these s3 interfacing clients want to deal with old data either.  So maybe I'm over-valuing the migration.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-06-27 21:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-2

-2 as a hold to get some additional opinions and to prevent landing a potential api change before thorough review'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-06-27 21:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575860/ is related "... because it needs to come up with *something* to send as the base etag for the container server"'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-06-29 02:20:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Thanks John for holding this.

Technically speaking I like this approach to be consistent with listening result and the actual object response header for general use case but I'm still waiting the answer from our Swift solution team that uses SLO for their customer so please wait a moment until I get the conclusion for our use cases.

Much appreciated that you brought this to me."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-07-03 18:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Kota, any updates on this?'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-07-04 04:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

I got the answer just short before, and that is "no problem" with this change for our productions. And I support the purpose of this change that makes the etag being consistent between listing result and HEAD object result.

+1 because I could not have enough time to test in my local with this but code looks reasonable so no opposition that any core reviewers add +A to get this merged.'}, {'account_id': 14766, 'date': '2018-07-04 09:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

This implementation looks good to me.
I'm worried about crypt middlewares' behavior with X-Object-Sysmeta-Container-Update-Override-Etag a little.
But in my understanding, the header will be correctly encrypted and decrypted by them.
So I added +1."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-07-05 23:12:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

Will re-work to expose both the MD5 of the manifest *and* the SLO etag in JSON listings, while also being smart enough to make https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575860/ not need to know about SLO etags at all.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-07-06 22:37:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-07-06 23:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-2 by John Dickinson <me@not.mn>
'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-07-10 22:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-07-12 03:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

It'll be super handy to have that new key in the listings going forward, legacy clients shouldn't even notice.

This change itself is small, and looks great to me.  Best I can tell it seems to work exactly as tim described it - the design makes makes sense to me.

The order of middleware and handling of the etag header all make sense with EC & Encryption.

I don't entirely understand the interaction/relationship with symlinks besides that they *also* have a "stuff some data in the etag container update hole" trick - i don't think it should interfere and indeed symlinks still seem to do their container listing thing.

It was under unittested for my preference, but I added a stub in a follow up [1] - which is good enough for me given the necessary and sufficient functests.

We have an existing problem with then container listing API being under-documented.

SHIP IT!

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581943/

commit_message:
Include SLO ETag in container updates

Container servers will store an etag like

   <MD5 of manifest on disk>; slo_etag=<MD5 on concatenated ETags>

which the SLO middleware will break out into separate

   "hash": "<MD5 of manifest on disk",
   "slo_etag": "\"<MD5 of concatenated ETags\"",

keys for JSON listings. Text and XML listings are unaffected.

If a middleware left of SLO already specified a container update
override, the slo_etag parameter will be appended. If the base header
value was blank, the MD5 of the manifest will be inserted.

SLOs that were created on previous versions of Swift will continue to
just have the MD5 of the manifest in container listings.

Closes-Bug: 1618573
Change-Id: I67478923619b00ec1a37d56b6fec6a218453dafc

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-07-12 02:07:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

i don't think the CI failures are related.

I tried:

python setup.py sdist

and:

python setup.py bdist

and in both cases I already get the .rngs

I don't know *why* it already worked for me, it's not obvious that it should [1]

I tried to understand how the --format=rpm stuff works, but I guess it's crazy [2]

Either way, this doesn't BREAK anything either, so maybe it helps someone else.

1. https://docs.python.org/2/distutils/sourcedist.html#specifying-the-files-to-distribute
2. https://docs.python.org/2/distutils/builtdist.html#creating-rpm-packages"}]

[doc] Correct the wrong title

Click into the hyperlink, and its title is 'Command Line Interface',

commit_message:
Replace deprecated "auth_uri" by "www_authenticate_uri"

According to [1], "auth_uri" has been deprecated.
This patch replace it by using "www_authenticate_uri" instead.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522

Change-Id: Id773a00c333c2f81421afef639cbba528d5bc589

commit_message:
Add docker packages to OVN metadata agent container

The OVN metadata agent container needs to be able to launch docker
containers for its subprocesses.

Change-Id: Ic7dcbe33f361a09eaa8e54270d758d09eb7a1e72
Related-Bug: #1749209
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2458872776f748101e19684a4bcfe1dc82d96360)

commit_message:
Always define properties for image even if empty

This re-factor allows us to set default properties very simply.  It does
add empty properties on images that otherwise didn't have them but this
should be safe[1]

[1] famous last words

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: I136ae6c59bb4a4b3e12eb6a96bfbce732554bb4c

commit_message:
Replace raw_get with dict access syntax

We used `raw_get` because of a bug we found in ansible a while back.
This doesn't seem to be a problem anymore so we're switching back to
subscript syntax to remove a bit of boilerplate.

Change-Id: Ib5873ca617fbe38ffc6bc4d52cb4c936a94472c5

commit_message:
HA support for OpenShift

The OSA assisted HA deployment is not recommended for production
environments, besides it being limited. Therefore, we're relying on our
deployment of HAproxy + Keepalived to provide HA on top of OpenShift in
addition to adding more OpenShift nodes.

Depends-On: Ib573758b515264d1dda90cc9de61f4fa6659dc7d

Change-Id: I7ab677e4803e9df5f6641204cb0b6ccc5b1eb79f

[{'created': '2018-07-11 14:35:58.000000000', 'message': 'Disable sensu-client in CI

After CI scenario deployment is finished the container ends in unhealthy
state because sensu-client is not successfully connected to RabbitMQ.
We will need to implement default connection to overcloud RabbitMQ instance
for the service to have this service deployed in CI job.

Change-Id: I1aec0c71a945c06a6d914638b45cae074288a90d
Closes-Bug: #1781108

commit_message:
Disable sensu-client in CI

After CI scenario deployment is finished the container ends in unhealthy
state because sensu-client is not successfully connected to RabbitMQ.
We will need to implement default connection to overcloud RabbitMQ instance
for the service to have this service deployed in CI job.

Change-Id: I1aec0c71a945c06a6d914638b45cae074288a90d
Closes-Bug: #1781108

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 01:55:30.000000000', 'message': "Move live migration tests out of scenario job

'tempest-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend' job used to run
- all scenario test including slow tests with lvm multi-backend setup
- live migration and migration tests

This commit make scenario job only run the scenario tests and exclude
migration and live migration tests out of it.

coverage of those tests are there in below jobs
- migration tests run as part of -  'neutron-tempest-multinode-full'
- live migration tests run as part of - 'nova-live-migration'

This helps to provide a generic job to run the scenario tests in parallel
including slow tests so that project like nova, cinder, neutron etc can
use this job ti run on their main pipeline.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130418.html

Change-Id: Ibddd633a3fdccb11100f5bc150c4595147402237

commit_message:
Move live migration tests out of scenario job

'tempest-scenario-multinode-lvm-multibackend' job used to run
- all scenario test including slow tests with lvm multi-backend setup
- live migration and migration tests

This commit make scenario job only run the scenario tests and exclude
migration and live migration tests out of it.

coverage of those tests are there in below jobs
- migration tests run as part of -  'neutron-tempest-multinode-full'
- live migration tests run as part of - 'nova-live-migration'

This helps to provide a generic job to run the scenario tests in parallel
including slow tests so that project like nova, cinder, neutron etc can
use this job ti run on their main pipeline.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130418.html

Change-Id: Ibddd633a3fdccb11100f5bc150c4595147402237

messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:11:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-10 05:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncheck-rdo'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-11 18:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 12:11:18.000000000', 'message': "Make sure remotes are fully up before proceeding

We currently rely on 'verify_on_create   => true' to make
sure that pacemaker remotes up before proceeding to Step2 (during
which a remote node is entitled to run pcs commands).
So if the remote is still not fully up pcs commands can potentially
fail on the remote nodes with errors like:

Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Profile::Pacemaker::Compute_instanceha
       /Pacemaker::Property[compute-instanceha-role-node-property]
       /Pcmk_property[property-overcloud-novacomputeiha-0-compute-instanceha-role]:
Could not evaluate: backup_cib: Running: /usr/sbin/pcs cluster cib
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20180519-20162-ekt31x failed with code: 1 ->

verify_on_create => true has an incorrect semantic currently
as it does not really wait for a single resource to be fully up.
Since implementing that properly will take quite a bit of work
(given that pcs does not currently support single-resource state
polling), for now we avoid using verify_on_create and we simply make
sure the resource is started via an exec.

Run 25 successful deployments with this (and the depends-on) patch.

Closes-Bug: #1773754
Depends-On: I74994a7e52a7470ead7862dd9083074f807f7675
Change-Id: I9e5d5bb48fc7393df71d8b9eae200ad4ebaa6aa6
(cherry picked from commit 5968aeb3207b4c42cc65eb7a7d3a831c4c28d456)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure remotes are fully up before proceeding

We currently rely on 'verify_on_create   => true' to make
sure that pacemaker remotes up before proceeding to Step2 (during
which a remote node is entitled to run pcs commands).
So if the remote is still not fully up pcs commands can potentially
fail on the remote nodes with errors like:

Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Profile::Pacemaker::Compute_instanceha
       /Pacemaker::Property[compute-instanceha-role-node-property]
       /Pcmk_property[property-overcloud-novacomputeiha-0-compute-instanceha-role]:
Could not evaluate: backup_cib: Running: /usr/sbin/pcs cluster cib
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20180519-20162-ekt31x failed with code: 1 ->

verify_on_create => true has an incorrect semantic currently
as it does not really wait for a single resource to be fully up.
Since implementing that properly will take quite a bit of work
(given that pcs does not currently support single-resource state
polling), for now we avoid using verify_on_create and we simply make
sure the resource is started via an exec.

Run 25 successful deployments with this (and the depends-on) patch.

Closes-Bug: #1773754
Depends-On: I74994a7e52a7470ead7862dd9083074f807f7675
Change-Id: I9e5d5bb48fc7393df71d8b9eae200ad4ebaa6aa6
(cherry picked from commit 5968aeb3207b4c42cc65eb7a7d3a831c4c28d456)

[{'created': '2018-07-10 15:03:55.000000000', 'message': 'Drop example in config file comments

There have been some reports of users misinterpreting
where to place configuration for the provisining subnets
in undercloud.conf. The example text for the subnets leads
to users adding the subnets section directly after the
subnets option. I.e in the middle of the DEFAULT section
of the ini file.

This change drops the example. The ctlplane-subnet section
is there as an example already.

Related-Bug: rhbz1585497
Related-Bug: #1778779
Change-Id: I417623db410330058d30fe7435112f01a0f72c83
(cherry picked from commit 930e2ca49d9515fcf0cc91614be2e3595a6e898b)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop example in config file comments

There have been some reports of users misinterpreting
where to place configuration for the provisining subnets
in undercloud.conf. The example text for the subnets leads
to users adding the subnets section directly after the
subnets option. I.e in the middle of the DEFAULT section
of the ini file.

This change drops the example. The ctlplane-subnet section
is there as an example already.

Related-Bug: rhbz1585497
Related-Bug: #1778779
Change-Id: I417623db410330058d30fe7435112f01a0f72c83
(cherry picked from commit 930e2ca49d9515fcf0cc91614be2e3595a6e898b)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifd00a3b9e803a5cf4fa13b6c8abfe48c113aacb8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 12:13:01.000000000', 'message': 'Be consistent with haproxy group name

Without this patch, two different groups are used
for haproxy: "haproxy" and "haproxy_all".

This is a problem if you want to deploy openstack-ansible
with a static inventory, and only define one of the groups:
"haproxy". You would define the group "haproxy" because it
is already the one used in group_vars. In that case, the
group var resolution for galera_all would fail, as
groups['haproxy_all'] does not exist.

This patch solves the problem by ensuring the only
group used for haproxy is named "haproxy" and not "haproxy_all".

Change-Id: Ic43564a8cbcb1aa30ac9b805c04f409dbf885b2e
'}]
commit_message:
Be consistent with haproxy group name

Without this patch, two different groups are used
for haproxy: "haproxy" and "haproxy_all".

This is a problem if you want to deploy openstack-ansible
with a static inventory, and only define one of the groups:
"haproxy". You would define the group "haproxy" because it
is already the one used in group_vars. In that case, the
group var resolution for galera_all would fail, as
groups['haproxy_all'] does not exist.

This patch solves the problem by ensuring the only
group used for haproxy is named "haproxy" and not "haproxy_all".

Change-Id: Ic43564a8cbcb1aa30ac9b805c04f409dbf885b2e

commit_message:
Fix stop node before delete error handling

Log warning message instead of returning error when a cluster is trying
to stop a node but fails to do so.  Then proceed to delete the node.
This change is needed because in case of a failure to stop a node, the
node should still be deleted to clean it up.

Change-Id: I345ddb47d4f7715bfc7251c4eb2a520bbbcabdf3

subject: Fix redirect to https bug and testing
messages: [{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-07-04 12:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-11 17:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-07-12 00:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-04 12:53:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix redirect to https bug and testing

Fixes a bug where having listen_ssl and ssl_redirect
set to true did not redirect http to https if your
root_url was empty or '/'.

This now forces redirection from http to https no
matter what your root_url is if listen_ssl and ssl_redirect
is set to true.

This also cleans up all apache::wsgi::apache testing and fixes
the structure so it doesn't enforce some context tests only for
the SSL enabled context but for everything.

(cherry picked from commit a56420e5ef88b9431e4a31d06aa723bf61c34d76)

Change-Id: Ib06f9f7d9d730fc0f6d98eed23200b541dc05531
"}]
commit_message:
Fix redirect to https bug and testing

Fixes a bug where having listen_ssl and ssl_redirect
set to true did not redirect http to https if your
root_url was empty or '/'.

This now forces redirection from http to https no
matter what your root_url is if listen_ssl and ssl_redirect
is set to true.

This also cleans up all apache::wsgi::apache testing and fixes
the structure so it doesn't enforce some context tests only for
the SSL enabled context but for everything.

(cherry picked from commit a56420e5ef88b9431e4a31d06aa723bf61c34d76)

Change-Id: Ib06f9f7d9d730fc0f6d98eed23200b541dc05531

commit_message:
Remove heat_watch_server_url parameter

In change I155c92edd5d6959ac23d99804fd95dfb99c7042e the
heat-api-cloudwatch support was removed from puppet-heat. In change
Icb9fa01cb37dd15b66fc6f1de183149ff884363d the forgotten parameter
heat_watch_server_url was also removed from puppet-heat. This change
removes this parameter from the heat::engine call in heat.pp

Change-Id: I2d33868ce8ce87565e1fa7125aa9f36463813b2e

commit_message:

allows backwards compatibility to ensure that the service tokens are
compared against a list of possible roles for validity.

Implements: bug service_token_roles_required missing
Closes-Bug: 1778198

[{'created': '2018-07-04 02:09:02.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I49f086554515284d5dc3af4c1b93fa272e0c35a1

Change-Id: I49f086554515284d5dc3af4c1b93fa272e0c35a1

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I49f086554515284d5dc3af4c1b93fa272e0c35a1

Not Found

The resource could not be found.< ...aren't super-useful generally.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-01-29 16:02:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1 I think not returning the traceback makes sense. We could maybe do better in the general sense for *any* ClientError? But if I swift delete something that 404's I exit 1 - why is it obvious that deleting segments should silently squash 404? Does it cause the remaining segments to not get DELETEs issued or the command to exit early? Loss of information seems dubious?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-29 18:23:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: We call this in two places: _delete_object and _upload_object_job. In both cases, we're trying to clean up a large object. I'm not sure that it matters to us whether the large object was broken or not; we want it (and all of its segments) gone. I don't think it's terribly valuable to know that some segments were missing or your container listings are out-of-date."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-07-11 23:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 landing based on existing reviews'}, {'account_id': 27190, 'date': '2018-07-12 00:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]

Remove enable config option of trust feature

Then `enable` config option of trust feature is depreacted in
Queens. Remove it in Rocky now.

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: Ie08a59019a8f1862ffd0b85f07168dd4dd28b943

- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.

Change-Id: I61129acf42b1c39c212c91ae0db06342472808b6

commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I61129acf42b1c39c212c91ae0db06342472808b6

commit_message:
compute disks: use the generic compute pollster

The disks code is almost identical to the cpu/mem
code. So share it.

Change-Id: Ic7a272bd433577995bcd0db9be859ad6bd8e4ffa

Use coverage+stestr for the cover tox target.

Clean jobs after switching to wsgi by default in master

Remove the non-voting modwsgi job from master, now useless
(the base job uses wsgi).
Add two scenario test jobs against the stable branches to catch
regressions.

Task: 19617

This test created three ports and tried to list and filter those
ports by their vnic type. However, the current implementation
doesn't support filter by vnic type. The test passed is a false
positive because neutron ignored the invalid filter and returned
all the ports which happened to be those three ports.

This patch remove this invalid test case.

commit_message:
Remove the unit test 'test_ports_vnic_type_list'

This test created three ports and tried to list and filter those
ports by their vnic type. However, the current implementation
doesn't support filter by vnic type. The test passed is a false
positive because neutron ignored the invalid filter and returned
all the ports which happened to be those three ports.

This patch remove this invalid test case.

Change-Id: I4397df1c35463a8b532afdc9c5d28b37224a37b4
Related-Bug: #1749820

Some QoS tests tried to list ports by attribute qos_policy_id

commit_message:
Fix the tests for filtering with qos_policy_id

Some QoS tests tried to list ports by attribute qos_policy_id
but this attribute is not a valid filter. In before, the tests
passed because neutron ignored the invalid filter and returned
all the ports which happened to be the correct set. However,
using qos_policy_id as filter is incorrect and this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ic3ab5b3ffdc378d570678b9c967cb42b0c7a8a9b
Related-Bug: #1749820

[{'created': '2018-07-10 12:02:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IP lookup when no container_networks

Without this patch, the set _network_data directive fails when
container_networks is not defined, and the whole address lookup
fails.

This is a problem because, some inventories might not ship
container_networks, and rely on default behavior to fallback
to ansible_host.

This fixes the issue by simplifying the lookup, and relying on
jmespath behavior to fallback to data when its not found,

Change-Id: Ib3fce08290f71d1b8682167c722089f52ad7a301

commit_message:
Fix IP lookup when no container_networks

Without this patch, the set _network_data directive fails when
container_networks is not defined, and the whole address lookup
fails.

This is a problem because, some inventories might not ship
container_networks, and rely on default behavior to fallback
to ansible_host.

This fixes the issue by simplifying the lookup, and relying on
jmespath behavior to fallback to data when its not found,
reducing the amount of jinja written to find the data.

Change-Id: Ib3fce08290f71d1b8682167c722089f52ad7a301

commit_message:
Change approach to saharaclient authentication

We'll commit to the idea of constructing a session based on token auth
here in the sahara-dashboard code itself. And in preparation for some
upcoming python-saharaclient changes, move certificate settings into
that session object.

Change-Id: I5f76af0e14822513849af2e75445af837af85285
Story: 1747838

Due to the bug below we want to have py-amqp>=2.3.0 so that connecting
to rabbit endpoints don't timeout when relying on /etc/hosts entries.
Closes-Bug: 1780992

[{'created': '2018-07-10 03:33:22.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I204e381701c91e59558eee57efac7ae7566acf76

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I204e381701c91e59558eee57efac7ae7566acf76

commit_message:
Fix the coverage tox target

It was broken for a long while, since the migration
of the dashboard code into Horizon, and then back
into this repository, as .testr.conf was removed.

Use coverage directly instead of testrepository,
the same way as Horizon does. We should port
the normal test runner to the Django test runner too,
instead of the custom run_tests.sh script, but
that's for another (future) review.

Change-Id: I08966ddc7e891156a1c934bb115ce8a02f77ec83

commit_message:
S3 data source

* Create S3 data source type for EDP
* Support storing S3 secret key in Castellan
* Unit tests for new data source type
* Document new data source type and related ideas
* Add support of S3 configs into Spark and Oozie workflows
* Hide S3 credentials in job execution info, like for Swift
* Release note

Change-Id: I3ae5b9879b54f81d34bc7cd6a6f754347ce82f33

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-07-10 04:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-10 17:30:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nNote to self: the 'venv' tox environment should be probably removed completely."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-11 22:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 04:47:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I695bb1b311b8d66d3c4fb966158a4e50f223c4dd
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I695bb1b311b8d66d3c4fb966158a4e50f223c4dd

commit_message:
use get reader/writer session from neutron-lib

The get_reader_session and get_writer_session functions are available
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes them by removing the functions
from neutron and using lib's instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I4055172799a0d9a0ceb387b6d47e421e1c270ada

commit_message:
On container destroy remove container journal

When a container is destroyed ensure that the journal, which is likley
being written to the host is also removed.

Change-Id: I9f7493b80c0b8c9d064fb8ce16fb305a7c944a94
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Nagios: Update image reference to include discovery fix
messages: [{'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-07-10 19:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-07-11 19:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-07-11 21:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 19:42:05.000000000', 'message': 'Nagios: Update image reference to include discovery fix

This updates the Nagios image tag to include a version that fixes
the service discovery bug that resulted in duplicate host group
entries. The duplicate host group entries would prevent Nagios
from restarting, resulting in the service never coming back up
when duplicate host groups were identified and added

Change-Id: I555c525e47deffd95eeb5a7276c00cf044e61e3a
'}]
commit_message:
Nagios: Update image reference to include discovery fix

This updates the Nagios image tag to include a version that fixes
the service discovery bug that resulted in duplicate host group
entries. The duplicate host group entries would prevent Nagios
from restarting, resulting in the service never coming back up
when duplicate host groups were identified and added

Change-Id: I555c525e47deffd95eeb5a7276c00cf044e61e3a

commit_message:
Add script to customize Ubuntu guest images.

The script is intended to be used from any openstack deployment	system
as TripleO, Devstack, etc. to prepare ubuntu guest images before being
uploaded to OpenStack image service.

It has not been possible to virt-customize because of below Ubuntu bugs:
 - https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libguestfs/+bug/1632405
 - https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/isc-dhcp/+bug/1650740

It has therefore been adopted a more low level strategy performing below
steps:
 - mount guest image to a temporary folder
 - set up an environment suitable for executing chroot
 - execute customize_image function inside chroot environment
 - cleanup chroot environment

Packages required by the script:
 - libguestfs-tools

Packages installed on customized guest images:
 - socat (for advance network feature testing, like multicast)

This change has been created because for testing multicast
socat is required, but it was designed with the idea
of being used to allow further guest images customizations.

Change-Id: Ia60991d9170495e9d41f583765b24d6cdf442639

[{'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-07-06 17:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-06 17:39:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd want a functional regression test for this to make sure we are properly handling the API interaction here - see how we handle this in nova/tests/functional/regressions/. A simple test like this should do it based on the description in the commit message:

Set server group member quota to 2, create 1 instance in the group, then request 2 more instances from the same request in the same group and it will pass the check but ultimately end up with 3 members in the group."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-06 17:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(12:39:09 PM) melwitt: I reproduced the problem in devstack and know why it's happening. just set quota to 2 and boot 3 instances into the group with --max-count 3"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-06 20:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I've written a couple of functional regression tests that recreate the bug in different forms. I'm going to rebase this change on top of that.

As for the fix, I think we can do away with what you have here and instead count build requests in the server_group_members quota check method here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/fcf406003bcde2b60a515f694f2640e27a9d65fd/nova/quota.py#L1266

So you'd need to get the build requests by the group.members uuids, something like this:

build_requests = objects.BuildRequestList.get_by_filters(context, filters)

And then from that list you have to remove any duplicates between the list of build_requests and the list of instances pulled from the cells since there can be a small window of time where the instance exists in a cell database before we've deleted it's related build request record from the API DB."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-06 20:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-06 20:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-07-07 02:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fix server_group_members quota check

For example there are 3 instances in a server group (quota is 5).
When doing multi-creating of 3 more instances in this group
(would have 6 members), current quota checking scheme will fail to
prevent this happening, which is not expected.

This is due to the server_group_members quota check previously
only counting group members that existed as instance records in
cell databases and not accounting for build requests which are
the temporary representation of the instance in the API database
before the instance is scheduled to a cell.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If439f4486b8fe157c436c47aa408608e639a3e15
Closes-Bug: #1780373

[{'created': '2018-07-06 20:36:52.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regressions tests for server_group_members OverQuota

Since we started counting quotas in Pike, it is possible to bypass
the server_group_members qouta check if either creating multiple
servers in a single request or creating one server each in multiple
concurrent requests. This is because the server_group_members
count is based on existing server group members in the cell database
and those group members (instances) don't get created in a cell until
we get to conductor and after the scheduler picks a host. In other
words, the server_group_members quota check in the API does not account
for build requests.

Change-Id: Icb268ca2f792bfcefd152ba4c6aa13270d9a7900
Related-Bug: #1780373
"}, {'created': '2018-07-06 20:57:44.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regressions tests for server_group_members OverQuota

the server_group_members qouta check if either creating multiple
servers in a single request or creating one server each in multiple
concurrent requests. This is because the server_group_members
count is based on existing server group members in the cell database
and those group members (instances) don't get created in a cell until
we get to conductor and after the scheduler picks a host. In other
words, the server_group_members quota check in the API does not account
for build requests.

Change-Id: Icb268ca2f792bfcefd152ba4c6aa13270d9a7900
Related-Bug: #1780373
"}]
commit_message:
Add functional regressions tests for server_group_members OverQuota

Since we started counting quotas in Pike, it is possible to bypass
the server_group_members qouta check if either creating multiple
servers in a single request or creating one server each in multiple
concurrent requests. This is because the server_group_members
count is based on existing server group members in the cell database
and those group members (instances) don't get created in a cell until
we get to conductor and after the scheduler picks a host. In other
words, the server_group_members quota check in the API does not account
for build requests.

Change-Id: Icb268ca2f792bfcefd152ba4c6aa13270d9a7900
Related-Bug: #1780373

[{'created': '2018-07-02 21:11:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix quota error when deleting temporary volume

When deleting a volume, always use the admin context to fetch the
admin_metadata that indicates whether it's a temporary volume.

This fixes a bug where a non-admin user failed to retrieve the
admin_metadata, which caused the volume to not be treated as temporary.
This, in turn, caused quota usage to be incorrectly updated.

Closes-Bug: #1778774
Change-Id: I8e6b0c726dc6498b28795a1ea0520ef05e53f047
(cherry picked from commit 8d9f8629013bcb880fb3e33f03b274c10befdab0)

"}]
commit_message:
Fix quota error when deleting temporary volume

When deleting a volume, always use the admin context to fetch the
admin_metadata that indicates whether it's a temporary volume.

This fixes a bug where a non-admin user failed to retrieve the
admin_metadata, which caused the volume to not be treated as temporary.
This, in turn, caused quota usage to be incorrectly updated.

Closes-Bug: #1778774
Change-Id: I8e6b0c726dc6498b28795a1ea0520ef05e53f047
(cherry picked from commit 8d9f8629013bcb880fb3e33f03b274c10befdab0)
(cherry picked from commit 23729bdda4099908a205f6d60f64ffad712f820e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 02:13:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix TypeError in prep_resize allocation cleanup

The CachingScheduler doesn't create allocations in
placement so when prep_resize fails and it tries
to revert allocations, the _revert_allocation() method
returns False and then prep_resize calls
delete_allocation_for_failed_resize() which since change
I7891b98f225f97ad47f189afb9110ef31c810717 has taken a
context argument, but that's not being passed so it
results in a TypeError.

This fixes the TypeError and adds a functional test case
which runs a resize reschedule scenario with the
CachingScheduler.

Change-Id: I0ec0c2d3f7ef8d2274b97a28a175d53921edc9db
Closes-Bug: #1781100
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in prep_resize allocation cleanup

The CachingScheduler doesn't create allocations in
placement so when prep_resize fails and it tries
to revert allocations, the _revert_allocation() method
returns False and then prep_resize calls
delete_allocation_for_failed_resize() which since change
I7891b98f225f97ad47f189afb9110ef31c810717 has taken a
context argument, but that's not being passed so it
results in a TypeError.

This fixes the TypeError and adds a functional test case
which runs a resize reschedule scenario with the
CachingScheduler.

Change-Id: I0ec0c2d3f7ef8d2274b97a28a175d53921edc9db
Closes-Bug: #1781100

commit_message:
Add queued for delete to instance_mappings table.

This column is being added to have information regarding an instance
being active/deleted in the nova-api database as a part of the handling
a down cell spec.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: Ic6253acab2ae08025d65add9a5be9ed463457290

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 20:03:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when a network contains more that one IPv4
subnet, they are returned in the 'classless-static-routes'
DHCP option, regardless of whether DHCP is enabled for them
or not.

However, the get_active_networks_info() method used for
synchronizing networks after the dhcp agent restarts filters
subnets with "enable_dhcp=True", which differs from the
get_network_info() method.  This will block VM access to
other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets, even though they are
in the same network.  This is visible by looking at the "opts"
file before and after a restart.

Change the dhcp agent to ask for all subnets in its
get_active_networks_info() RPC call by adding an
enable_dhcp_filter argument to toggle the behavior, with the
default being True to not break backwards compatibility.

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352530/ by Quan Tian.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: I11ca1d1a603d02587f3b8d4a5a52a96b0587d61f
Closes-Bug: #1652654
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when a network contains more that one IPv4
subnet, they are returned in the 'classless-static-routes'
DHCP option, regardless of whether DHCP is enabled for them
or not.

However, the get_active_networks_info() method used for
synchronizing networks after the dhcp agent restarts filters
subnets with "enable_dhcp=True", which differs from the
get_network_info() method.  This will block VM access to
other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets, even though they are
in the same network.  This is visible by looking at the "opts"
file before and after a restart.

Change the dhcp agent to ask for all subnets in its
get_active_networks_info() RPC call by adding an
enable_dhcp_filter argument to toggle the behavior, with the
default being True to not break backwards compatibility.

Based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/352530/ by Quan Tian.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: I11ca1d1a603d02587f3b8d4a5a52a96b0587d61f
Closes-Bug: #1652654

Well, it's running:

Flavor Migration                             |\n| Result: Success                                            |\n| Details: None                                              |\n+------------------------------------------------------------+\n| Check: API Service Version                                 |\n| Result: Success                                            |\n| Details: None                                              |\n+------------------------------------------------------------+", "stdout_lines": ["+------------------------------------------------------------+", "| Upgrade Check Results                                      |", "+------------------------------------------------------------+", "| Check: Cells v2                                            |", "| Result: Success                                            |", "| Details: None                                              |", "+------------------------------------------------------------+", "| Check: Placement API                                       |", "| Result: Failure                                            |", "| Details: Placement API version 1.24 needed, you have 1.17. |", "+------------------------------------------------------------+", "| Check: Resource Providers                                  |", "| Result: Success                                            |", "| Details: None                                              |", "+------------------------------------------------------------+", "| Check: Ironic Flavor Migration                             |", "| Result: Success                                            |", "| Details: None                                              |", "+------------------------------------------------------------+", "| Check: API Service Version                                 |", "| Result: Success                                            |", "| Details: None                                              |", "+------------------------------------------------------------+"]}

Looks like it's complaining about the placement API check.

"Details: Placement API version 1.24 needed, you have 1.17."

Placement API 1.17 is the maximum in Queens:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/placement.html#add-required-parameter-to-the-allocation-candidates-maximum-in-queens

So, is OSA upgrading placement *after* nova? Because if so, that's a problem and this definitely caught it.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-14 21:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-14 22:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-16 18:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

What happens if we run `nova-status upgrade check` after a fresh deployment?  Could we just not do that every time the installing packages are redeployed?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-19 00:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> What happens if we run `nova-status upgrade check` after a fresh deployment? Could we just not do that every time the installing packages are redeployed?

You can run it on a fresh install (per the commit message). The way grenade handles it is:

1. deploy new code
2. restart placement (needed for one of the checks and because nova depends on placement being upgraded first)
3. run nova-status upgrade check to see if you missed anything for data migrations
4. restart nova services with new code'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-20 18:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-20 18:38:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

So, we're literally not creating a cell0 database, rebased to a patch that fixed that.  Once that's done, I'm going to see how we can restart the placement service first if we have to."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-20 19:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-20 19:23:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

So, I've proposed the following patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576944/

What I would like us to do (and I can help this if you're a bit short on time, Matt):

1. Run nova-status upgrade check once, ignore exit code, store output
2. Run follow up tasks *if* output of the above command includes their case (example: restart placement if placement version is out of date)
3. Re-run it, checking for the exit code == 0 to be a success."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-20 20:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-20 22:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

So it looks like we need to find a way to start up placement before running this.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-02 11:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-02 14:43:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

You'll notice in https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/blob/65aea833c80a6563cd251f8fa93439a8af664a55/tasks/main.yml#L87-L92 that we only run the DB setup on a single node, and I think that perhaps there's better value in running this diagnostic tool on all the nodes. However, I'm happy to be convinced otherwise by you Matt.

Something that may be pertinent to the failure we're seeing in this patch is that on a greenfield build none of the services will have started until https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/blob/65aea833c80a6563cd251f8fa93439a8af664a55/tasks/main.yml#L145-L146 which will flush all handlers, thereby starting/restarting the services and waiting for the placement service to be active.

As such, I suggest adding this new task to the end of tasks/main.yml instead of in the db setup. This is what's been done for keystone-doctor in the keystone role. :)"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-05 12:37:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

> You'll notice in https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/blob/65aea833c80a6563cd251f8fa93439a8af664a55/tasks/main.yml#L87-L92 that we only run the DB setup on a single node, and I think that perhaps there's better value in running this diagnostic tool on all the nodes. However, I'm happy to be convinced otherwise by you Matt.

By all nodes do you mean also compute nodes? If so, we don't need to since the command, so far, doesn't check anything specific to a compute node, it relies on the controller node config to be able to reach things that the compute service shouldn't be able to, like the API DB (which is used to iterate over the cell DBs and check things like compute service versions).

> As such, I suggest adding this new task to the end of tasks/main.yml instead of in the db setup. This is what's been done for keystone-doctor in the keystone role. :)

OK I can try that. Thanks for the pointer."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-05 12:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Ah, we can then skip the command running on compute nodes with something like:

when:
 - "nova_services['nova-compute']['group'] not in group_names"

That said, if it's an all-in-one without containers then that'll skip it all together, so perhaps it's better just to do this to run it on the conductor nodes (which have DB access):

when:
  - "nova_services['nova-conductor']['group'] in group_names"'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-05 12:41:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> That said, if it's an all-in-one without containers then that'll skip it all together, so perhaps it's better just to do this to run it on the conductor nodes (which have DB access):

Ack, was just looking at that. Will do, thanks."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-05 12:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-05 17:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-11 19:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-11 19:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Run "nova-status upgrade check" during install and upgrade

This adds a task to run the 'nova-status upgrade check' command
post-install/upgrade after cells and placement setup is done and
online data migrations have been run.

This is generally used for verifying an upgrade once the control
services have been upgraded, nova API DB has been migrated and
online data migrations have been run, but is also good to run
post-install for greenfield deployments:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/install/verify.html

This is also an important tool for fast-forward upgrades to
make sure each release being forwarded through has been properly
upgraded before moving onto the next.

Change-Id: I73da0679563383d682a5f617b4a224d8f83a0523

commit_message:
Cleanup keystone's removed config options

token.provider.drvier.uuid and token.driver
has been removed from keystone[1].

Devstack has reference/setting of those config
options which is confusing for user and it can
lead to import error like[2]

This commit cleanup the devstack bits of removed
config options.

bp removed-as-of-rocky

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/removed-as-of-rocky

[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/725391/

Change-Id: I29b3b356622c485c4c1046679234a38e7b645071

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I22f8a992540ad192ac8fd67050512f163cc58cb4

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

[{'created': '2018-07-09 06:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

py35 and py36.

'}, {'created': '2018-07-09 09:19:28.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

Change-Id: I7c161e4b57db8553554d8bb120c3dd91998c838a
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7c161e4b57db8553554d8bb120c3dd91998c838a

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I24bb866f53bc48d65c65a2251d50502c386a8ed0

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iadbc25016279958768928e9c63ee545c0bca0e23

commit_message:
Revert "Disable keystone_authtoken/service_token_roles_required for now"

This reverts commit e88a3a6f72f0aad27abf5138a37ff363d0cb3829.

Given that most roles aren't yet instrumented to use service_token_roles
we have removed the setting in the os_nova role, so this override is no
longer necessary.

Change-Id: Ib3e22000fe1d641671b759172c892c1928db6a4d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/581625

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging service for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace
the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be transparent
to the trove service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation (add for notification)
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tests
* Update docs
* Update extras
* Add release note

Change-Id: Ia01317343ae6fbc790d64b5ba282c8c069750d45

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc17989df724900c48ea9345bdb9f0154c7dbe6f

subject: Pin get-pip.py to 3.2
messages: [{'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-07-05 15:31:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-05 15:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-07-10 09:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-11 19:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 15:31:55.000000000', 'message': "Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I24609eb753e8c041842bd3b0cc6d404ad9d7cb22
"}]
commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I24609eb753e8c041842bd3b0cc6d404ad9d7cb22

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2095d534c536cb2c00fe652f06a6f65dde1d993e

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If28474c5c68649785b19fd07bf9287da5f378e8e

subject: Pin get-pip.py to 3.2
messages: [{'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-07-05 15:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-05 15:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-07-10 09:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-11 19:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 15:26:57.000000000', 'message': "Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I49f6c9b238b42d4840c17af222e3bc82dfa6167f
"}]
commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I49f6c9b238b42d4840c17af222e3bc82dfa6167f

subject: allow do_repo.sh to reuse existing branch
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-11 18:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-11 18:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 18:51:21.000000000', 'message': 'allow do_repo.sh to reuse existing branch

If we have to make any local changes to a repository before we add the
zuul settings, we can pre-create the branch, add a patch, and
do_repo.sh will reuse that branch.

Change-Id: I7f11cbb310e9f487af4e5ec717e3c187629fd480
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
allow do_repo.sh to reuse existing branch

If we have to make any local changes to a repository before we add the
zuul settings, we can pre-create the branch, add a patch, and
do_repo.sh will reuse that branch.

Change-Id: I7f11cbb310e9f487af4e5ec717e3c187629fd480
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: allow wide output in yaml files
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-11 18:51:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-11 18:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 18:51:21.000000000', 'message': "allow wide output in yaml files

The default width for the yaml formatter is 80 columns but we don't
enforce that. Set the width very wide to avoid superfluous changes in
generated patches.

Change-Id: I7a2d1e35ca9c5244cd03af2a40f6738bdfec2369
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
allow wide output in yaml files

The default width for the yaml formatter is 80 columns but we don't
enforce that. Set the width very wide to avoid superfluous changes in
generated patches.

Change-Id: I7a2d1e35ca9c5244cd03af2a40f6738bdfec2369
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Do not assign default value to deprecated parameters

Otherwise it will always throw deprecation warnings.

Change-Id: I4992571f63cac02f082e12e45cf30160849d16de

commit_message:
Do not run tasks for containers when on metal

Without this patch, ansible parses the includes for containers,
even when running on metal, and therefore even if there is no
reason to do so.

This is a problem because some of those includes rely on variables
set by our dynamic inventory, and would fail when running OSA
with a static inventory on metal.

This patch solves the problem by ensuring the task will not
run unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I101b121d3d94673597a705979c38ea207043555f
