commit_message:
Filter project_id for list limits

When list limits, if more than one filter is provided and
"project_id" is contained, the limits should be filtered
with "project_id" as well.

Closes-bug: #1780896
Change-Id: I7c231130358ab8d7b0b2f507c52d34366ca0060a

[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(4 comments)

Validated that this covers all the places where we catch ConcurrentUpdateDetected (the ones in allocation.py were already setting this error code).

Note that, from the point of view of the API consumer, generation conflicts we detect in the db in _increment_*_generation are the same as those we detect in python by explicitly comparing the incoming generation to what was in the db at the start of the transaction. So we should identify those and set the same error code. (And those paths *are* testable.)

So there is more work to do here, but it can be done in a separate patch. This one is a good improvement.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 13:19:56.000000000', 'message': '[placement] add error.code on a ConcurrentUpdateDetected

A pending api-sig guideline
I473918ce9c6b49c0b904e93b7140421525f4e7c0 reflects discussion amongst
various parties that adding error codes to structured error responses
should not be considered a breaking API change.

Given that, it is simply "okay" to add them. This change adds
errors.CONCURRENT_UPDATE wherever the ConcurrentUpdateDetected results
in an HTTPConflict (409) response.

In practice this means that if microversion 1.23 or beyond is being
used, there will be a code in any error response, and for some
409 responses that code will be `placement.concurrent_update`.

Note that because we haven't instrumented a way to cause a truly
concurrent update, we've never had real tests for this kind of
thing.

Change-Id: I5a164a0ee298846231113ad7b62b82a3e8f1f409
'}]
commit_message:
[placement] add error.code on a ConcurrentUpdateDetected

A pending api-sig guideline
I473918ce9c6b49c0b904e93b7140421525f4e7c0 reflects discussion amongst
various parties that adding error codes to structured error responses
should not be considered a breaking API change.

Given that, it is simply "okay" to add them. This change adds
errors.CONCURRENT_UPDATE wherever the ConcurrentUpdateDetected results
in an HTTPConflict (409) response.

In practice this means that if microversion 1.23 or beyond is being
used, there will be a code in any error response, and for some
409 responses that code will be `placement.concurrent_update`.

Note that because we haven't instrumented a way to cause a truly
concurrent update, we've never had real tests for this kind of
thing.

Change-Id: I5a164a0ee298846231113ad7b62b82a3e8f1f409

commit_message:
Add more rabbitmq options

Adds the rabbit_ha_queues, rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold
and rabbit_heartbeat_rate parameters that is used to configure
oslo messaging.

Change-Id: Iaf5679283e56f112b15d8440f57d708b525bb024

subject: Fix code to support networkx > 1.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:20:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-25 15:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-25 16:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Thanks for taking a look at this!

While we wait for test results on the latest patch set, I had one question inline.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-26 08:06:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ben, because taskflow's classes ( Graph, DiGraph, OrderedDiGraph and OrderedGraph ) are inherited from networkx classes ( nx.Graph, nx.Digraph, nx.OrderedDiGraph and nx.OrderedGraph ).

In inherited method from networkx => create_empty_copy(G, with_data=True): https://github.com/networkx/networkx/blob/v1.11/networkx/classes/function.py  there is called G.__class__ ( in old version of networkx ) which is calling taskflow's defined class constructor and is returning object with the desired class type.

In new version of networkx this call was replaced by method fresh_copy, which is calling networkx's function fresh_copy and returns instance of nx.Graph, nx.DiGraph etc... so you have to override this method in your taskflow's inherited classes and returns same object type as the G parameter..

By the way, in networx's code in function fresh_copy is explicitly written this : If you subclass the base class you should overwrite this method to return your class of graph.
https://github.com/networkx/networkx/blob/bf1c7cc9b144767523e5abcf84f949d4223848a0/networkx/classes/graph.py

You can also check the migration manual here. https://networkx.github.io/documentation/stable/release/migration_guide_from_1.x_to_2.0.html , you can find explanation there as well.

Just check networkx pieces of code what i noted above and everything will be clear for you I think."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-26 19:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-27 13:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-28 10:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-28 12:35:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-28 13:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-06-28 17:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Note that you can run a lot of these tests locally with tox.  tox -e py35,py27,pep8 will run all of the unit/style checks.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-29 15:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-02 08:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Test were passing with networkx > 2.0 as the review was depending on I1d13dd20bcbb68e6d46d795e0f6e1440cdd60377 , code was rewritten after discussion on irc with openstack-global-requirements guys to support also old version of networkx < 2.0 . Reason is that we needs to release taskflow supporting both versions , to pass requirements tests with old networkx ..and in the future remove support for networkx < 2.0'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-02 08:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-02 10:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-03 09:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-05 17:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-05 21:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(2 comments)

Thanks for working on this!'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-05 23:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-05 23:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-05 23:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

Thanks for taking this on."}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-11 09:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2018-07-11 11:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-11 16:31:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 14:20:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix code to support networkx > 2.0

With the release of NetworkX 2.0 the reporting API was
moved to view/iterator model. Many methods were moved from
reporting lists or dicts to iterating over the information.
Methods that used to return containers now return views and
methods that returned iterators have been removed in networkx.
Because of this change in NetworkX 2.0 , taskflow code
have to be changed also to support networkx > 2.0

Change-Id: I23c226f37bd85c1e38039fbcb302a2d0de49f333
Closes-Bug: #1778115
'}, {'created': '2018-06-25 15:55:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix code to support networkx > 2.0

commit_message:
Fix code to support networkx > 1.0

With the release of NetworkX 2.0 the reporting API was
moved to view/iterator model. Many methods were moved from
reporting lists or dicts to iterating over the information.
Methods that used to return containers now return views and
methods that returned iterators have been removed in networkx.
Because of this change in NetworkX 2.0 , taskflow code
have to be changed also to support networkx > 2.0

Change-Id: I23c226f37bd85c1e38039fbcb302a2d0de49f333
Closes-Bug: #1778115

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ifeb63d8d8afa6e820afc205f22c9d31c3d80045b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 17:18:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add Oslo feature freeze to release schedule

Per [1], Oslo observes feature freeze earlier than most projects in
order to give consuming projects a chance to implement any new
features in Oslo before their feature freeze.  This should be
reflected in the release schedule.

Change-Id: Ib822c34c1ade20dcdaa5c9667f91e0639e0f56df
1: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/policy/feature-freeze.html
'}]
commit_message:
Add Oslo feature freeze to release schedule

Per [1], Oslo observes feature freeze earlier than most projects in
order to give consuming projects a chance to implement any new
features in Oslo before their feature freeze.  This should be
reflected in the release schedule.

Change-Id: Ib822c34c1ade20dcdaa5c9667f91e0639e0f56df
1: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/policy/feature-freeze.html

commit_message:
Add puppet-4 puppet-apply jobs to check

For some reason we have these jobs voting in the gate but not running in
the check, which is not ideal. They seem to be happy in the gate[1] so
let's have them in check too.

[1] https://zuul.openstack.org/builds.html?job_name=infra-puppet-apply-4-ubuntu-xenial

Change-Id: I805c7506484e775e51441215d64579b230cf9aec

subject: Resolve deprecation syntax warning
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-16 08:59:58.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve deprecation syntax warning

Avoid warnings like below by adopting
the recommended syntax.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using tests as filters is deprecated. Instead of using `result|failed` instead use `result is failed`. This feature will be removed in version 2.9. Deprecation warnings can be disabled by setting deprecation_warnings=False in
ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: If89bba4ef09c96a06b76db610b94053ecfc1dee8
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve deprecation syntax warning

Avoid warnings like below by adopting
the recommended syntax.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using tests as filters is deprecated. Instead of using `result|failed` instead use `result is failed`. This feature will be removed in version 2.9. Deprecation warnings can be disabled by setting deprecation_warnings=False in
ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: If89bba4ef09c96a06b76db610b94053ecfc1dee8

commit_message:
Test for unsanitized consumer UUID

Add a gabbi test case demonstrating that the consumer with UUID
{8}-{4}-{4}-{4}-{12} is not the same as the consumer with UUID
{8}{4}{4}{4}{12}.

Change-Id: I1852ac6004fedc5dfa9dd3de187c937ab385d1b5
Related-Bug: #1758057

commit_message:
Raise timeout for instance resizing checking job

Recently the trove-functional-mysql usually failed by timeout at
the test_instance_returns_to_active_after_resize case, and the cause is
creating and resizing instances could be quit slow(e.g. 1200+ seconds).
This may be caused by the pressure of the CI system and should be
further investigated. The patch is a quick fix for the problem by
raising the timeout to 30 minutes(it's now 900 seconds by default, but
instead it's 32 minutes for instance creating, so raising the value to
30 minutes should be reasonable).

Partial-Bug: #1778837

Change-Id: Ib903a72b098499553978ec881843a7bbee25b45f
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Updates OpenDaylight HA Proxy backend check

The new URI is more accurate and only supported as of ODL version
Fluorine. It will also return an HTTP error code when the ODL is
isolated from the cluster so that HA Proxy will not send it requests.

Closes-Bug: 1715387

Change-Id: Ib841b2fc68e5b1f6480298afce20b91a7afef634
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove testrepository

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository is unnecessary
and should be removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/578522

commit_message:
Support to wait for load balancer to be ACTIVE

This patch is adding a utility method `wait_for_load_balancer` that can
be used either in user's application or the ansible module.

Story: 2002924
Task: 22907
Change-Id: I68daeb44d9206892078e8d199b076b2f93234241

commit_message:
Skip calls to glance and nova when got no servers

save (potentially many) HTTP calls to Glance API for image list
and a call to Nova API for flavor list when the server list
actually returned no servers.

Change-Id: I93a56138c50b82fb4dce67a2f788107f71c5f423
Story: #2002039
Task: #19681

commit_message:
Replace pbr autodoc with sphinxcontrib-apidoc

This fixes local building of the documentation using tox, and allows the
gate to stop relying on pbr and move completely to the new docs PTI.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: I485acda07098a435753e91c1ca45e586de199c35

commit_message:
Add OPNFV scenario environment

Add an OPNFV scenario environment that uses ODL for overcloud
networking and OVS for virthost networking.

Depends-On: I3d049d042c6346378afe7f62a18e491bbbb7f54b
Change-Id: If1f476bb933106456df3568978b4555dde190621
(cherry picked from commit f3f4e2856c8e24654bb8b91b827b1215845cf24e)

commit_message:
Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: I4f31c4bd5368151ff9b236913c1937abdaa793ef

commit_message:
Fix occasional py27 test failures

test_ryu_base_app.TestRyuDFAdapter.test_switch_features_handler test
fails occasionally on the following error:

File "dragonflow/controller/datapath_layout.py", line 56, in get_datapath_layout
  with open(path) as f:
      No such file or diectory: '/etc/neutron/dragonflow_datapath_layout.yaml'

Closes-Bug #1781161
Change-Id: I4fdf835c688e46b42b540b70efd22331845e6c86

commit_message:
Add workflow to get available plans

This looks in the plan plan-samples directory and returns all
directories where a plan-environment.yaml file is found

Change-Id: I03ef49287f1d3450ec274796076c38a01aa9876c

commit_message:
Add utility workflow to verify if an object exists

This will be used to check if e.g plan-environment.yaml exists
in a plan container.

Change-Id: Iabb5a7fecd0d6889f3cd65188396e23a23874648

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ic388868baaf9a1204d4ad35f3467de564c1a56fa

commit_message:
Install openvswitch packages on 'ml2.ovs.dvr' configuration

The 'neutron_package_list' is extended when 'neutron_needs_openvswitch'
is true. Which needs neutron_services['neutron-openvswitch-agent'].service_en
to be true. Which it is only for 'ml2.ovs' and not 'ml2.ovs.dvr'.

Change-Id: I6a4f597377e711508f26b142d7184cfd08b3ffaa
Depends-On: I2fbb0785a3179b4213c999344c35e52637fe3f1f

subject: Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-07-11 15:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 12:27:29.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ic2615a261e433ce7ec8c0ef1d9c2061286a05739
(cherry picked from commit b5923cf7d2174efcb012966846644c36ad580fa7)

commit_message:
Fixes ordering of environment files in a deployment plan

Sometimes making changes in basic deployment breaks the order of
passed env files and leads to a failed deployment.  This patch
orders the environment files according to the rules defined in
the capabilities-map.yaml file.

Change-Id: Idbb6f0f3adebebd429bcb3447e559838180f4b1c

commit_message:
Provide proper error message if interface name is invalid

Currently if an invalid interface name is used for the
"openstack baremetal introspection interface show" command the
unhelpful message "need more than 0 values to unpack" is
returned.  This fix returns a better message.

Story: 2002749
Task: 22603
Change-Id: I0556b64e39c5b3e9be0cfecfb6d741a4e5cd16e7

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.

Let's switch it then.

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I32db99af179412f46b02ced9eaf61049cbffcdb0

commit_message:
Ensure python2 is used in the ansible venv

This ensures all the commands are running with a python2
environment, until we are ready for python3.

Change-Id: I5f51e76a23015a08d4e05a4e9082e227a3e62743

commit_message:
Fix Magnum cluster update

The only attribute can be updated is 'node_count' not 'name'[1]. This
patch fixes it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/api/validation.py#L32

Change-Id: Idb7578f63e688d9fdc85a8514d00ad03b99d8f83

[{'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-07-09 21:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-07-09 21:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is a timing problem where this ntpdate command may fail because os-net-config is still running and restarting networking services.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-09 21:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

bug report & details should be posted before proposing reverting stuff.'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-07-10 16:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Alex saw that the ntp issue was only happening on compute nodes. I thought it was happening on controller too, so when I ran ntpdate after os-net-config finished it worked right as the deployment failed which caused the confusion. The real cause looks to be that we do not put IPs on the compute node external network interfaces in OPNFV, so the command fails and deployment fails. Testing a fix in OPNFV then if it passes will abandon this patch.'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-07-11 14:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Adding an IP to the computes fixed the issue and baremetal deployments are passing on master in OPNFV again:
https://build.opnfv.org/ci/job/apex-deploy-baremetal-master/2563/console'}]

commit_message:
move haproxy to neutron-metadata-agent

During pike cycle, haproxy is deployed on metadata agent for the
metadata proxy service. Adding the haproxy to the whole pkg list made
it install everywhere there is neutron installed. neutron server and
compute agent don't need to have haproxy installed. this patch move
haproxy to the neutron-metadata-agent group.

Depends-On: I2fbb0785a3179b4213c999344c35e52637fe3f1f
Change-Id: I1bd872a50ee506081b2d8274533a954a58a76fde

commit_message:
proposal/OSA: Sync the contents of the sync folder

We have an emerging need to synchronise a common set of tasks across
roles. While it may sometimes make sense to create a role for this
sort of thing, the overhead of doing so would be greater than simply
copying the file between roles. We're also finding include_role to
be somewhat buggy, especially when used from inside a role.

This patch adds the ability to copy a set of files from the source [1]
to the same path (without the 'sync' prefix) in the destination roles,
abiding by the same rules as all other synchronised files.

[1] openstack/openstack-ansible/tests/sync
Relates-to: https://review.openstack.org/579527
Change-Id: I598ff6aae50e6570d5f262c830c4be10f1cc0b75

commit_message:
Add docker packages to OVN metadata agent container

The OVN metadata agent container needs to be able to launch docker
containers for its subprocesses.

Change-Id: Ic7dcbe33f361a09eaa8e54270d758d09eb7a1e72
Related-Bug: #1749209
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

subject: Bump py-amqp to >= 2.3.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-10 15:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2018-07-10 16:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-11 00:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We don't need to do this on master.  Just do:

 diff --git a/lower-constraints.txt b/lower-constraints.txt
 index 3b088023..392c7412 100644
 --- a/lower-constraints.txt
 +++ b/lower-constraints.txt
 @@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
  alabaster==0.7.10
 -amqp==2.1.1
 +amqp==2.3.0
  appdirs==1.3.0
  Babel==2.3.4
  bandit==1.1.0
 diff --git a/requirements.txt b/requirements.txt
 index 254f9427..ef8ecab4 100644
 --- a/requirements.txt
 +++ b/requirements.txt
 @@ -26,7 +26,7 @@ PyYAML>=3.12 # MIT
  
  # rabbit driver is the default
  # we set the amqp version to ensure heartbeat works
 -amqp!=2.1.4,>=2.1.1 # BSD
 +amqp>=2.3.0 # BSD
  kombu!=4.0.2,>=4.0.0 # BSD
  
  # used by zmq driver

in oslo.messaging, and mess with it until it passes CI :D"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

ack Thanks Tony :)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-07-11 13:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581744/'}]

[{'created': '2018-07-10 15:29:21.000000000', 'message': "Bump py-amqp to >= 2.3.0

Due to the bug below we want to have py-amqp>=2.3.0 so that connecting
to rabbit endpoints don't timeout when relying on /etc/hosts entries.

Change-Id: Ieb266f440aa84d93dab7e5b92b557b4111d5808b
"}]
commit_message:
Bump py-amqp to >= 2.3.0

Due to the bug below we want to have py-amqp>=2.3.0 so that connecting
to rabbit endpoints don't timeout when relying on /etc/hosts entries.
Closes-Bug: 1780992

Change-Id: Ieb266f440aa84d93dab7e5b92b557b4111d5808b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 09:12:22.000000000', 'message': "Use 'become' for haproxy service state setting

Due to the use of delegation to localhost in this task,
we also need to set 'become' otherwise the task does not
have access to the socket because it's executed as the
user running the playbook (zuul).

Change-Id: I3da65d9ecdf0a91104b6253466fae80dda01b25f
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'become' for haproxy service state setting

Due to the use of delegation to localhost in this task,
we also need to set 'become' otherwise the task does not
have access to the socket because it's executed as the
user running the playbook (zuul).

Change-Id: I3da65d9ecdf0a91104b6253466fae80dda01b25f

commit_message:
Initialize alarm in test_alarm_metric_mixcase

In some cases thresholding engine needs longer to evaluate the first
measurement and checking the alarm state returns UNDETERMINED. To make
the test safer, we send the first measurement to initialize the alarm.

Change-Id: Ib294952d29b5c1c464baa24978f4c18a257fe0bc
Story: 2001539
Task: 20046

commit_message:
NetApp: Deprecate E-Series drivers

The deprecation for the E-Series iSCSI/FCP drivers
begins this release (Rocky) and the drivers will be removed
in Stein. We will run E-Series CI until
stable/rocky is tagged EOL; no new features will be added,
however, existing code may be meaningfully refactored to
keep the drivers ready for removal.

Change-Id: Iea8ca99fa55743e910af47d19af150cb9fd9ecf2

commit_message:
Support disabling floating IPs in swarm mode

We use the same technique that is used for kubernetes clusters, with a
custom heat resource that provides either a floating IP, or
OS::Heat::None when disabled. We also add coverage tests for swarm-mode.

Change-Id: I3b5877bcd89fc2436776f49e479ffadf72c00ea3
Story: 1772433
Task: 21662
Task: 22102
Co-authored-by: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
(cherry picked from commit b7bfee5d27ee8c21ea00b3b5ed0278003eacb7a7)

commit_message:
hardware: fix hugepages memory usage per intances

In the algo to compute memory, when several instances are their memory
backed on a same host NUMA node, we always compute the memory used
based on the initial 'used' value of hostcell.

Partial-Bug: #1594529
Change-Id: I5b8684b10688b91ca36a509ea0cb8bee397263d6
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
ansible: enable pipelining

SSH pipelining is an quick way of speeding up Ansible by executing
several ansible modules without actual file transfer
The boolean flag defaults to off because some systems have a /etc/sudoers
config that disallows it with sudo with the requiretty setting.
Enabling it so we can improve the performances a little.

Change-Id: Iffaa6548e69d18deaf2fb114041a33434044fc4f

commit_message:
Switch --use-heat to take a boolean and deprecate it

--use-heat parameter is deprecated in Rocky cycle and will be removed in
the future.
When --use-heat / --use-heat=True is set, the undercloud will be
containerized and a warning will be shown for the deprecation.
When --use-heat=False is set, the undercloud won't be containerized.

This allows the case where someone wants to deploy a non-containerized
undercloud even if it's not the recommended way in Rocky.

Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ibc6fb33d752346d6f8b3a61d74e0bc73c1ac20e3

pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to

(cherry picked from commit e79314ecd462f1388d72bada681cc792a588d8db)
"}]
commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I2a49a407e82c23540cd0aff209bd276c8a303bf0
Closes-Bug: 1779534
(cherry picked from commit e79314ecd462f1388d72bada681cc792a588d8db)

commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I2a49a407e82c23540cd0aff209bd276c8a303bf0
Closes-Bug: 1779534
(cherry picked from commit e79314ecd462f1388d72bada681cc792a588d8db)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 08:46:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loop variable name for nested loop

The HAProxy service management did not work because the loop variable
"item" was used in a nested loop within an include. Because of this the
haproxy Ansible module acted on an inexistant HAProxy backend.
Unfortunately the module does not throw an error in this case.

The issue is fixed by using loop_control/loop_var in the inner loop to
use another loop variable name.

Change-Id: Ia9d23f8861b53eadd7d4eff4a68683ebcda37dc2
(cherry picked from commit 144b8505636f7065519c6c905d0b184367396d82)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix loop variable name for nested loop

The HAProxy service management did not work because the loop variable
"item" was used in a nested loop within an include. Because of this the
haproxy Ansible module acted on an inexistant HAProxy backend.
Unfortunately the module does not throw an error in this case.

The issue is fixed by using loop_control/loop_var in the inner loop to
use another loop variable name.

Change-Id: Ia9d23f8861b53eadd7d4eff4a68683ebcda37dc2
(cherry picked from commit 144b8505636f7065519c6c905d0b184367396d82)

commit_message:
update project/user for consumer in allocation

Adds code to the util.ensure_consumer() method that updates the
consumer's project and user foreign key identifiers when a user supplies
a different external project or user identifier in the paylod of PUT
/allocations/{consumer_uuid} or POST /allocations.

Change-Id: I9368ad2280551ffa9a011d3a30c4b45861305455
Closes-bug: #1779717
Related-Bug: #1781008

commit_message:
Enable Ansible pipelining for containerized undercloud & standalone

SSH pipelining is an quick way of speeding up Ansible by executing
several ansible modules without actual file transfer
The boolean flag defaults to off because some systems have a /etc/sudoers
config that disallows it with sudo with the requiretty setting.
Enabling it so we can improve the performances a little.

Change-Id: Iccfc85796f660682bec3ec1b2cf7254801a88be3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 08:47:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loop variable name for nested loop

The HAProxy service management did not work because the loop variable
"item" was used in a nested loop within an include. Because of this the
haproxy Ansible module acted on an inexistant HAProxy backend.
Unfortunately the module does not throw an error in this case.

The issue is fixed by using loop_control/loop_var in the inner loop to
use another loop variable name.

Change-Id: Ia9d23f8861b53eadd7d4eff4a68683ebcda37dc2
(cherry picked from commit 144b8505636f7065519c6c905d0b184367396d82)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix loop variable name for nested loop

The HAProxy service management did not work because the loop variable
"item" was used in a nested loop within an include. Because of this the
haproxy Ansible module acted on an inexistant HAProxy backend.
Unfortunately the module does not throw an error in this case.

The issue is fixed by using loop_control/loop_var in the inner loop to
use another loop variable name.

Change-Id: Ia9d23f8861b53eadd7d4eff4a68683ebcda37dc2
(cherry picked from commit 144b8505636f7065519c6c905d0b184367396d82)

subject: Do not set service_token_roles_required = True for now
messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-11 08:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-11 08:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-11 08:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 08:35:14.000000000', 'message': 'Do not set service_token_roles_required = True for now

This change was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578618/

When this value is set to True, the service user should be assigned a
service role listed in the service_token_roles configuration key.

Otherwise other services which use the nova API will not work properly
(see the discussion in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569886/ )

Apparently this is not the case for nova, where the service role
seems to be "admin", but the value of service_token_roles has
the default value of 'service' (it is not explicitly set).

So change back to the default value, even if it leads to a deprecation
warning.

For more details see:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1779889
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ansible/%23openstack-ansible.2018-07-10.log.html#t2018-07-10T17:47:14
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-keystone/%23openstack-keystone.2018-07-10.log.html#t2018-07-10T16:52:31

Change-Id: I08f32350b867ae0d26806b2d1774051467e90eb5
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set service_token_roles_required = True for now

This change was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578618/

When this value is set to True, the service user should be assigned a
service role listed in the service_token_roles configuration key.

Otherwise other services which use the nova API will not work properly
(see the discussion in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569886/ )

Apparently this is not the case for nova, where the service role
seems to be "admin", but the value of service_token_roles has
the default value of 'service' (it is not explicitly set).

So change back to the default value, even if it leads to a deprecation
warning.

For more details see:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1779889
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ansible/%23openstack-ansible.2018-07-10.log.html#t2018-07-10T17:47:14
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-keystone/%23openstack-keystone.2018-07-10.log.html#t2018-07-10T16:52:31

Change-Id: I08f32350b867ae0d26806b2d1774051467e90eb5

commit_message:
Disable keystone_authtoken/service_token_roles_required for now

Sahara currently cannot use this option, so we work around it being
set by default in the os_nova role by disabling it via a config
override.

This allows other roles to still use it by default, but specifically
disables it for os_sahara tests.

Change-Id: I11e342975e6a043fdba455d01c6dcfadbef1984f

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html

commit_message:
Make service account private key hidden

The service account private key needs to be hidden for safety reasons.
This patch fixes it.

Task: 22886
Story: 1766546

commit_message:
Added information regarding system's clock - must be set to UTC

If the clock isn't set to UTC, it might create some weird issues, and
basically the deploy might fail because of "future file" being present
on the system.

Change-Id: Ib0a636af8edb644d8807c0d5df1cbdecfea2352d

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

We should do like so:
[root@kube-lb-11-6q5jrvtfsa7b-master-0 fedora]# curl -s http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
ok[root@kube-lb-11-6q5jrvtfsa7b-master-0 fedora]# python -c "import requests ; print(requests.get('http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz').status_code)"
200
[root@kube-lb-11-6q5jrvtfsa7b-master-0 fedora]# systemctl stop etcd
[root@kube-lb-11-6q5jrvtfsa7b-master-0 fedora]# python -c "import requests ; print(requests.get('http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz').status_code)"
500
[root@kube-lb-11-6q5jrvtfsa7b-master-0 fedora]# curl -s http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
[+]ping ok
[-]etcd failed: reason withheld
[+]poststarthook/generic-apiserver-start-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-controllers ok
[+]poststarthook/bootstrap-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/rbac/bootstrap-roles ok
[+]poststarthook/ca-registration ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-apiserver-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-aggregator-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-registration-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-status-available-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-openapi-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/kube-apiserver-autoregistration ok
[+]autoregister-completion ok
healthz check failed
[root@kube-lb-11-6q5jrvtfsa7b-master-0 fedora]# echo $?
0
[root@kube-lb-11-6q5jrvtfsa7b-master-0 fedora]# 


I think we need another loop to do something like:
if [ 200 -eq $(python -c "import requests ; print(requests.get('http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz').status_code)") ] ;
then
    echo 200
else
    echo "probably 500 :)"
fi'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

It is way easier:
if [ "ok" = "$(curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz)" ] ; then echo ok ; else echo "Not ok" ; fi

The problem is that even by curl-ing the api, when the kube-api is up
it mat reply something but with 500. If any of the components are not
up  the requests returns 500 but the process returns exit code 0.
Only when the kube-api is down curl returns non zero and the until
loop is respected.

In this example, the api replied:
+ echo 'Waiting for Kubernetes API...'
Waiting for Kubernetes API...
+ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
+ sleep 5
+ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
+ sleep 5
+ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
[+]ping ok
[+]etcd ok
[+]poststarthook/generic-apiserver-start-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-apiextensions-controllers ok
[-]poststarthook/bootstrap-controller failed: reason withheld
[-]poststarthook/rbac/bootstrap-roles failed: reason withheld
[-]poststarthook/ca-registration failed: reason withheld
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-apiserver-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/start-kube-aggregator-informers ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-registration-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-status-available-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/apiservice-openapi-controller ok
[+]poststarthook/kube-apiserver-autoregistration ok
[-]autoregister-completion failed: reason withheld
healthz check failed
+ kubectl ...

But the script continued.

We should check if the api replies with ok or not.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Even another error below is fixed:
+ echo 'Waiting for Kubernetes API...'
Waiting for Kubernetes API...
++ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
+ '[' ok = '' ']'
+ sleep 5
++ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
+ '[' ok = '' ']'
+ sleep 5
++ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
+ '[' ok = '' ']'
+ sleep 5
++ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/healthz
+ '[' ok = ok ']'
+ kubectl apply --validate=false -f -
+ cat
clusterrole "system:kube-apiserver-to-kubelet" created
+ kubectl apply --validate=false -f -
+ cat
clusterrolebinding "system:kube-apiserver" created
+ ADMIN_RBAC=/srv/magnum/kubernetes/kubernetes-admin-rbac.yaml
+ '[' -f /srv/magnum/kubernetes/kubernetes-admin-rbac.yaml ']'
+ echo 'Writing File: /srv/magnum/kubernetes/kubernetes-admin-rbac.yaml'
Writing File: /srv/magnum/kubernetes/kubernetes-admin-rbac.yaml
++ dirname /srv/magnum/kubernetes/kubernetes-admin-rbac.yaml
+ mkdir -p /srv/magnum/kubernetes
+ cat
+ kubectl apply --validate=false -f /srv/magnum/kubernetes/kubernetes-admin-rbac.yaml



This one:
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002589


It was returning:
+ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/version
+ sleep 5
+ curl --silent http://127.0.0.1:8080/version

+ kubectl apply --validate=false -f -
error: unable to recognize "STDIN": no matches for rbac.authorization.k8s.io/, Kind=ClusterRole
+ cat
+ kubectl apply --validate=false -f -'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-07-09 14:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/725350/'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-07-09 18:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-07-09 18:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Spyros, nice catch!'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-07-11 03:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2018-07-11 06:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-07-11 09:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

"}, {'created': '2018-07-02 22:51:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix etcd race condition issue

We're using k8s API /version to check the API availibility which is
not a good way. Using /healthz to replace the /version. The main
reason is because /version only reflects if the basic k8s api is
working on not. And it will return response even the etcd service is
down, please refer below test result for more details.

[fedora@k8scluster-3-ukudmktpz4bp-master-0 ~]$ until curl --silent "http://127.0.0.1:8080/version"; do sleep 5; done

commit_message:
Fix etcd race condition issue

Currently, Magnum is using k8s API /version to check the API
availibility which is not a good way because /version only
reflects if the basic k8s api is working on not. And it will
return response even the etcd service is down. This patch fixes
it by using /healthz to replace /version.

Task: 22566
Story: 1775759

Change-Id: I45a1bd48a22842a251dafa6c349f0022fd319e3f

subject: Trivial fix typo of description
messages:
[{'account_id': 28427, 'date': '2018-07-11 09:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-07-11 09:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

https://docs.openstack.org/sahara/latest/contributor/development-guidelines.html#modification-of-upstream-files

"We never modify upstream files in Sahara. Any changes in upstream files should be made in the upstream project and then merged back in to Sahara. This includes whitespace changes, comments, and typos. Any change requests containing upstream file modifications are almost certain to receive lots of negative reviews. Be warned.

Examples of upstream files are default xml configuration files used to configure Hadoop, or code imported from the OpenStack Oslo project. The xml files will usually be found in resource directories with an accompanying README file that identifies where the files came from. "'}, {'account_id': 28427, 'date': '2018-07-11 10:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Thank you very much, Luigi Toscano'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-07-10 13:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-07-11 07:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-07-11 07:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 13:21:27.000000000', 'message': 'FFU Create cell0 db points to the nova-api bootstrap node.

In case the nova-api service is not running in the MySQL
master node, the FFU tasks will fail as it might not have
MySQL installed.

Avoid executing Nova DB tasks on FFU if MySQL not installed,
point to the MySQL server.

Resolves: rhbz#1593910
Closes-bug: 1780425

Change-Id: I02bc48d535707d579ecd590f970b1a08962a0111
(cherry picked from commit 00ed1a2d39fcbf73fd0ecc9ca8fd1dfe1cffdd6f)
'}]
commit_message:
FFU Create cell0 db points to the nova-api bootstrap node.

In case the nova-api service is not running in the MySQL
master node, the FFU tasks will fail as it might not have
MySQL installed.

Avoid executing Nova DB tasks on FFU if MySQL not installed,
point to the MySQL server.

Resolves: rhbz#1593910
Closes-bug: 1780425

Change-Id: I02bc48d535707d579ecd590f970b1a08962a0111
(cherry picked from commit 00ed1a2d39fcbf73fd0ecc9ca8fd1dfe1cffdd6f)

commit_message:
Add systemd tags to include role

There are times when a deployer will need to reconfigure parts of
an environment and having a general purpose tag to run said operation
will be important especicially should the deployer be needing to
reconfigure systemd unit files in a downtime event. This change adds
a general purpose systemd tag where include_role and systemd is found
which will assit operators with day2 operational tasks.

Change-Id: Ib37f4541152be2c3030aaded45829d37c5e2d389
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Replace port 35357 with 5000 for Keystone endpoint
messages: [{'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-05-21 04:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-07-11 09:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nThis change is not required anymore'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 04:22:09.000000000', 'message': 'Replace port 35357 with 5000 for Keystone endpoint

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for Keystone endpoint.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for Keystone endpoint

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for Keystone endpoint.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I10323237fb29d1d9f8d02da5cc27abf3bc2de8f9

commit_message:
Stop processing requests verify args

Now that openstacksdk handles insecure properly, we can get rid of the
logic here that re-does things.

Change-Id: I5a1abd781b12b73fa73f166d91687c2d5dd35356
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580795

[{'created': '2018-07-09 11:44:39.000000000', 'message': "neutron_needs_openvswitch should be jinja, not a string

In I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f the long conditional set
was broken out into its own variable to make it easier to grok, but
the new variable was not wrapped in jinja braces, so it's evaluated
as a string instead of jinja to interpret.

Also, all conditionals that use the variable should be checking for
a boolean value. Right now it might just consider the result true
because the variable exists, rather than the value of the variable.

Change-Id: Ic5210d62412ccf08e7d71860159aaaf37be9ddfd
(cherry picked from commit 6341bbe74392d70a2f8002194cad85d754d8afe1)
"}]
commit_message:
neutron_needs_openvswitch should be jinja, not a string

In I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f the long conditional set
was broken out into its own variable to make it easier to grok, but
the new variable was not wrapped in jinja braces, so it's evaluated
as a string instead of jinja to interpret.

Also, all conditionals that use the variable should be checking for
a boolean value. Right now it might just consider the result true
because the variable exists, rather than the value of the variable.

Change-Id: Ic5210d62412ccf08e7d71860159aaaf37be9ddfd
(cherry picked from commit 6341bbe74392d70a2f8002194cad85d754d8afe1)

commit_message:
Expose endpoint to return enforcement model

This commit wires up the last couple pieces of code to expose
a deployment's enforcement model information via the API. This
is going to be consumed by other services to make decisions about
quota calculation.

Change-Id: I02431d58b50aab2a2da8ca5f90938472aad7a935
Closes-Bug: 1765193

commit_message:
Update some placement docs to reflect modern times

This change provides a small number of updates to the placement user and
contributor documentation to reflect some of the things that have
changed recently. This is by no means complete, but is an improvement
over what was there.

Partial-Bug: #1778227

Change-Id: Ia348cd3c99b1a5104e15595fdebc83e1ca582a98

commit_message:
Add the new user and group for OpenvSwitch 2.8 version

OvS2.8, by default in fedora/centos/rhel, run as openvswitch:openvswitch
and when DPDK is enabled, it runs as openvswitch:hugetlbfs. Adding the
new user and group to the config.

Change-Id: I674cbd45e17906448dd54acfdf7a7059880b7278
(cherry picked from commit 5a2e5d7f2a2e7f4039391923ca20f785490364d7)

[{'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-21 14:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-21 14:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-21 14:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-22 13:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-22 22:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-25 00:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The idea of dropping things in element directories and having another element be able to copy them easily was what i was thinking exporting the list like this, so I do like this.

I don't want to derail this with too many options, but i'm thinking the sysctl one would be exactly the same.  it makes me wonder if we should just have some generic copy thing inside dib?  maybe that has come up before (@greghayenes?).  The complication i can see is *when* to copy; do we say look inside each "*.d"  directory at the start/end of the phsase for for maybe a "root-copy.d" type directory and then just replicate that into the final image?  or just have one top-level dir (like this) and do it at one point?

anyway, that does sort of break down if there is any sort of even trivial filtering requirements of the copied files, or some sort of operation you want to run (such as having the environment variable here).  So maybe I'm talking myself into having largely replicated elements like this and sysctl, just for the flexibility of being able to tweak them.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-25 07:46:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I was thinking the same , on having a generic copy element, and you could depend on it, and specify the source and target directories to copy. But i think that it's very generic, and that we may need tweaks in some of the copies (for example, in the case of sysctl, check for dupes before copying)"}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-26 21:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-26 22:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-26 22:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

sorry about the rebase, not clear why git-review did this'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-28 05:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I think I agree that various things have different copying requirements, so a stand-alone element is worth it.  Could you add a "..note" to the modprobe-blacklist element to say that it's 100% replaced by "modprobe" and I guess a changelog wouldn't hurt'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-06-28 11:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-11 06:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-07-11 06:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add new modprobe element

This element will replace modprobe-blacklist element. It wil
still have the blacklist functionality, but it also adds
the feature of passing a complete file with settings to the
modprobe.d directory. Adding this functionality, that will
allow elements that depends on this module, to just copy the
specified files to the final directory.

Change-Id: I9a44f7d11520b8b1e604956d3c1db2fc7e2bf457

commit_message:
Show disk space used by docker images in CI

The `docker system df` command can show the total size of the docker
cache. If you pass it the `-v` option, it will break it down per image,
replacing the use of `docker ps -a` and `docker images`.

This should be very useful in CI to see the variation in the images
size.

Change-Id: I407434d88f59df65693974265551c624420d4aaf

commit_message:
Added a field 'Kibana Url' in the installation script

Added field 'kibana_url' in notification.yaml and
replaced it with the kibana host only if global variable KIBANA_SERVICE_HOST
is set in the pre-install phase.

Change-Id: I384513cbbc402cef5755626cf0ccd866ec5484e4
Depends-On: I2bf6f4eda9617f194a97cce0698a4d88d00d8941
Story: 2001148
Task: 4880

commit_message:
Added a field 'Kibana Url' in the email notification

Fetch the 'kibana_url field' from notification.yaml and return the link
to Kibana only for metrics based on logs.
Unit tests for method get_kibana_url.
WIP because timestamp for the alarm is missing from the link.

Change-Id: I2bf6f4eda9617f194a97cce0698a4d88d00d8941
Story: 2001148
Task: 4878

messages: [{'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-07-05 16:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-07-05 16:41:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-07-06 06:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2018-07-06 16:20:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-07-11 06:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 16:40:28.000000000', 'message': "Support deploying Monasca Log Transformer

The Monasca Log Transformer takes raw, unstandardised logs from one
Kafka topic, standardises them with whatever rules the operator wants
to use, and then writes them to a standardised logs topic in Kafka. It
is currently implemented as a Logstash config file.

Since Kolla does a fairly good job of standardising logs, this service
does very little processing. However, when other sources of logs
are used, it may be useful to add rules to the Transformer, particularly
if it's not possible to standardise the logs at source.

Ingesting the logs from this service with Fluentd will be covered under
a different commit.

Change-Id: I31cbb7e9a40a848391f517a56a67e3fd5bc12529
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
"}]
commit_message:
Support deploying Monasca Log Transformer

The Monasca Log Transformer takes raw, unstandardised logs from one
Kafka topic, standardises them with whatever rules the operator wants
to use, and then writes them to a standardised logs topic in Kafka. It
is currently implemented as a Logstash config file.

Since Kolla does a fairly good job of standardising logs, this service
does very little processing. However, when other sources of logs
are used, it may be useful to add rules to the Transformer, particularly
if it's not possible to standardise the logs at source.

Ingesting the logs from this service with Fluentd will be covered under
a different commit.

Change-Id: I31cbb7e9a40a848391f517a56a67e3fd5bc12529
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles

commit_message:
Upgrade identity v2 to identity v3 API

As of the Queens release, Keystone solely implements the Identity
API v3. Support for Identity API v2.0 has been removed since Queens
in favor of the Identity API v3.

Change-Id: If65b26935e8bd1e6655d84259499f4013762e4e3
Closes-Bug: #1778846

commit_message:
Service_token_roles_required missing in authtoken config file Edit

Service_token_roles_required missing in the authtoken which
allows backwards compatibility to ensure that the service tokens are
compared against a list of possible roles for validity.

Change-Id: I67a358e921bd2a85caf242464327033562c46adc
Implements: bug service_token_roles_required missing
Closes-Bug: 1779389

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 17:56:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ownership of virtualenv in bootstrap-servers

In ..., creation of the kolla user was moved to after package
installation to ensure the sudo package is installed when required. This
change does not work when python dependencies are installed in a virtual
environment however - when the virtualenv variable is set.

This change moves the ownership change of the virtualenv to after the
kolla user has been created. It also uses the kolla_user and kolla_group
variables to set the user and group appropriately.

Change-Id: I320e5d611099ad162945a98d5505a79606da0eba
TrivialFix
'}, {'created': '2018-07-09 17:59:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ownership of virtualenv in bootstrap-servers

In I86bf5e1df3d6568c4f1ca6f4757f08a3dd22754d, creation of the kolla user
was moved to after package installation to ensure the sudo package is
installed when required. This change does not work when python
dependencies are installed in a virtual environment however - when the
virtualenv variable is set.

This change moves the ownership change of the virtualenv to after the
kolla user has been created. It also uses the kolla_user and kolla_group
variables to set the user and group appropriately.

Change-Id: I320e5d611099ad162945a98d5505a79606da0eba
TrivialFix
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ownership of virtualenv in bootstrap-servers

In I86bf5e1df3d6568c4f1ca6f4757f08a3dd22754d, creation of the kolla user
was moved to after package installation to ensure the sudo package is
installed when required. This change does not work when python
dependencies are installed in a virtual environment however - when the
virtualenv variable is set.

This change moves the ownership change of the virtualenv to after the
kolla user has been created. It also uses the kolla_user and kolla_group
variables to set the user and group appropriately.

Change-Id: I320e5d611099ad162945a98d5505a79606da0eba
TrivialFix

commit_message:
Update glance packages name for Fedora

For services starting from Fedora, RPM specs from [1]
and repos [2] would be used. Do necessary changes in
glance packages names.

Also do not hard code packages name, instead take them
from glance::params.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/rpm-packaging/blob/master/openstack/glance/glance.spec.j2
[2] https://trunk.rdoproject.org/fedora/current/

Change-Id: Ibee5776116ebecf9f1e28632c4ab6317075ca868

commit_message:
update sahara.conf file for kolla

The use of [keystone_authtoken] credentials for trust creation is now
 deprecated. refer to [1][2][3]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/sahara/blob/d16f07ea3ce448033774b69c142453cc7fa79383/releasenotes/notes/trustee-conf-section-5994dcd48a9744d7.yaml

[3] https://github.com/openstack/sahara/blob/d60a3b152b4ff3ba48cb9199eac1aad8e182f6e1/sahara/utils/openstack/keystone.py#L116

[{'created': '2018-07-02 20:25:35.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp driver] NVE License not present fix

commit_message:
[NetApp driver] NVE License not present fix

Since the addition of NVE support in the NetApp ONTAP driver,
the driver fails to start when a VE license is not present on
a 9.1 (or later) ONTAP box.

This patch fixes the problem by improving error handling.

Change-Id: I27bf9f0d1be666f4151281ca52d6bb3377f856ff
Closes-Bug: #1772026

commit_message:
Implement basic Enforcer context manager

This commit builds the foundation for a context manager that can be
used for usage enforcement.

Subsequent patches will incorporate keystoneauth and perform calls
to keystone to verify project limits and registered limits,
incorporating them into the usage check.

Change-Id: I7c78c1979444a2a83189e2035a4ab72890abc5ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 20:55:13.000000000', 'message': 'Implement ProjectClaim objects

When calculating usage of a resource against a project, there is some
common information that we need to know as an enforcement library.
This can be referred to as a "claim", which consists of the name of
the resource being claimed, the project claiming the resources in the
request, and the quantity being claimed.

This commit adds some basic plumbing and tests that introduce this
object. Subsequent patches will introduce a context manager that
performs usage calculation using ProjecClaim objects.

Change-Id: Iacfa39535c58a7c6b49ba01c5ebf6bbb5f3fe8d1
'}]
commit_message:
Implement ProjectClaim objects

When calculating usage of a resource against a project, there is some
common information that we need to know as an enforcement library.
This can be referred to as a "claim", which consists of the name of
the resource being claimed, the project claiming the resources in the
request, and the quantity being claimed.

This commit adds some basic plumbing and tests that introduce this
object. Subsequent patches will introduce a context manager that
performs usage calculation using ProjecClaim objects.

Change-Id: Iacfa39535c58a7c6b49ba01c5ebf6bbb5f3fe8d1

subject: Ignore a port not found when deleting an LB
messages: [{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-07-10 17:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-07-10 17:53:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-07-11 02:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 17:17:33.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore a port not found when deleting an LB

There seems to be a case where we successfully retrieve the port
but when we try to update it might be gone because someone deleted
the vip port manually while our delete was scheduled.

Octavia does the right thing and marks the LB in ERROR bu this
will make our delete a bit more resilient to outside interference.

Change-Id: I847e46a674ba31c3e9669a99bf5c0268a3e26d23
(cherry picked from commit 81f2ebb7f2c6c5c067fd67265e802e0012c93be1)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore a port not found when deleting an LB

There seems to be a case where we successfully retrieve the port
but when we try to update it might be gone because someone deleted
the vip port manually while our delete was scheduled.

Octavia does the right thing and marks the LB in ERROR bu this
will make our delete a bit more resilient to outside interference.

Change-Id: I847e46a674ba31c3e9669a99bf5c0268a3e26d23
(cherry picked from commit 81f2ebb7f2c6c5c067fd67265e802e0012c93be1)

commit_message:
Leave undercloud images locally after prepare

This saves some time in undercloud deployment, because those images
don't have to be pulled from the undercloud registry.

This change also adds a --verbose so the output is more useful.

Change-Id: I8064d51bed9f3133a8192e9c1a7870f6bb69e2ab
Depends-On: Id75d5288c308e58143662703da3dddbdbcb0cdd9

commit_message:
fs003: deploy with instack-undercloud

In Rocky we make the containerized undercloud a default but we still
want to keep testing instack-undercloud until Stein. This patch updates
the fs003 so we keep testing this architecture with the new option.

Depends-On: I9e754a7efff4113c50c0c825d58461e6bc94aa24
Change-Id: Ieb9c867d4ddb12759c2ed0a2a74666e53a8d2ba0

commit_message:
Fix erroneous test labels in quota tests

There are some tests in the test_quota.py file that are erroneously
tagged as negative. This patch changes those tags to be positive to be
in line with the actual actions of the tests.

Change-Id: I68362ad614cb3bb01b1f3ec752cd581f6237a990
Closes-Bug: #1780861

subject: Adding support consistency groups
messages:
[{'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2017-12-06 04:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2017-12-06 04:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

i missed test code
will update'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:57:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2017-12-07 03:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2017-12-07 04:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-01-04 16:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm not convinced that a blind configuration option is the right way to implement support for consistency groups; only certain volume drivers support CG's, so although the policy changes belong in the cinder charm, I think that the subordinates providing integration with a backend that supports CG's should provide a configuration option and pass this  up to the cinder charm to then update policy.json files accordingly.  So this needs to be driven based on data provided over the storage-backend relations the application has."}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2018-07-11 03:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Adding support consistency groups

Adding support consistency groups
inserted policy.json for each releases except icehouse which is
not supporting this feature.

Change-Id: I8cc71ce5efd8b36879e010e449b89f5f7cf6843b
Closes-bug: #1729675

commit_message:
Revert "Debian: no fwaas l3 extensions"

After upstream code has been fixed to work with neutron-api and
neutron-rpc-server, and after this patch has been merged into the Debian
package, we can finally re-activate FWaaS in Debian.

This reverts commit 85a3fa6a0a07692d2e84fea661a2467582787d7f.

Change-Id: Idd94928567677cc46779a8261b436a96a35050e3

commit_message:
Fix docstrings to work with Sphinx 1.7.4

According to the thread at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130581.html
some projects including networking-midonet can not build docs with
sphinx 1.7.4+  This seems to be becaus the parser is now more strict?

This patch *seems* to fix those doc builds

Change-Id: Ie96dca126e727fc9a34eece1590a92f7dd3af426
Partial-Bug: 1771092

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in put (3)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of PUT in SchedulerReportClient.
When removing a resource provider from an instance allocation
and putting allocations to a resource provider,
the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: I7891b98f225f97ad47f189afb9110ef31c810717
Partial-Bug: #1734625

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 08:57:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add InstanceGroupPolicy object

The InstanceGroupPolicy object incorporates the policy info of
a instance group, including 3 field:
1. group_id: the instance group id.
2. rules: the policy rules of the group.
3. policy: the policy name.

This object will be used in InsanceGroup object.

Related to blueprint complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: I8a99671103097854638c66b7d1078d6cd10c3def

commit_message:
Add InstanceGroupPolicy object

The InstanceGroupPolicy object incorporates the policy info of
a instance group, including 4 field:
1. id: the instance group policy id.
2. group_id: the instance group id.
3. rules: the policy rules of the group.
4. policy: the policy name.

This object will be used in InstanceGroup object.
InstanceGroupPolicy is not created in the database directly,
but rather when its parent InstanceGroup is created.

Related to blueprint complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: I8a99671103097854638c66b7d1078d6cd10c3def

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 10:55:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia50ddb01572d662ae0eef9c7662d18cfa7d45eb9
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia50ddb01572d662ae0eef9c7662d18cfa7d45eb9

commit_message:
Use assertEqual(len(x), y) instead of assertTrue(len(x) == y)

assertEqual() will return a nicer error if it fails.

Change-Id: I30c48fa17eee287bb5f42ed9b46e47f10bd39bb6

commit_message:
Update root providers in same tree

When updating a parent provider of a resource provider, placement
didn't update a root provider of another resource provider in the
same tree.

This patch fixes it to update the root provider field of all the
resource providers in the same tree.

Change-Id: Icdedc10cdd5ebfda672ca2d65a75bf0143aa769c
Closes-Bug: #1779818

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-11 22:08:04.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use nova.db.api directly

nova/db/__init__.py was importing * from nova.db.api. This meant that
any time any code anywhere within the nova.db package was imported
then nova.db.api was too, leading to a cascade of imports that may
not have been desired. Also, in general, code in __init__.py is a pain.

Therefore, this change adjusts code that so that either:

* nova.db.api is used directly
* nova.db.api is imported as 'db'

In either case, the functionality remains the same.

nova.db.base has been changed to no longer get its DB_DRIVER from
configuration. Being able to configure the database driver was
deprecated in 13.0.0 (Mitaka) so should be ignored. A followup patch
will remove the configuration setting from nova/conf/database.py and
make an appropriate release note.

The primary goal of this change was to make it possible to import the
model files without having to import the db api. Moving the model files
to a different place in the directory hierarchy was considered, but
given that "code in __init__.py is a pain" this mode was chosen.

This looks like a very large change, but it is essentially adjusting
package names, many in mocks.

Change-Id: Ic1fd7c87ceda05eeb96735da2a415ef37060bb1a

commit_message:
Use nova.db.api directly

nova/db/__init__.py was importing * from nova.db.api. This meant that
any time any code anywhere within the nova.db package was imported
then nova.db.api was too, leading to a cascade of imports that may
not have been desired. Also, in general, code in __init__.py is a pain.

Therefore, this change adjusts code that so that either:

* nova.db.api is used directly
* nova.db.api is imported as 'db'

In either case, the functionality remains the same.

The primary goal of this change was to make it possible to import the
model files without having to import the db api. Moving the model files
to a different place in the directory hierarchy was considered, but
given that "code in __init__.py is a pain" this mode was chosen.

This looks like a very large change, but it is essentially adjusting
package names, many in mocks.

Change-Id: Ic1fd7c87ceda05eeb96735da2a415ef37060bb1a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 09:07:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add timeout for all HTTP requests via the requests library.

In oeder to avoid the HTTP request hangs, all the HTTP request through
the requests library will add a default timeout of 60s, which can be
configured by [default]/requests_timeout.

Change-Id: I047476a5d495b76478eb490e57556d7d07e8e24b
Closes-Bug: #1730618
'}, {'created': '2018-01-25 09:35:47.000000000', 'message': "Add timeout for common/image_service module's HTTP request via the requests library.

In oeder to avoid the HTTP request hangs, common/image_service module's
HTTP request through the requests library will add a default timeout of 60s,
which can be configured by [glance]/timeout.

Change-Id: I047476a5d495b76478eb490e57556d7d07e8e24b
Closes-Bug: #1730618
"}, {'created': '2018-01-26 02:46:58.000000000', 'message': "Add timeout for common/image_service module's HTTP request via the requests library.

In oeder to avoid the HTTP request hangs, you can
specify a int value for timeout in [glance]timeout now.

Change-Id: I047476a5d495b76478eb490e57556d7d07e8e24b
Closes-Bug: #1730618
"}, {'created': '2018-01-28 13:44:39.000000000', 'message': "Add timeout for common/image_service module's HTTP request via the requests library.

In oeder to avoid the HTTP request hangs, you can
specify a int value for timeout in [glance]timeout now.

Change-Id: I047476a5d495b76478eb490e57556d7d07e8e24b

commit_message:
Add timeout for common/image_service module's HTTP request via the requests library.

In oeder to avoid the HTTP request hangs, you can
specify a int value for timeout in [glance]timeout now.

Change-Id: I047476a5d495b76478eb490e57556d7d07e8e24b
Closes-Bug: #1730618

commit_message:
unquiesce instance after quiesce failure

If the call to compute_rpcapi.quisece_instance() raises an exception,
any uncaught exception will break out of the function
snapshot_volume_backed(). This can leave the instance in frozen state.

This patch adds a blanket Exception catch to the try block and calls
compute_rpcapi.unquiesce_instance() before reraising.

This has been seen in the wild with RPC timeouts, but this is not the
only possible genesis for an unknown error from quiesce_instance.

Change-Id: Idca5998da8bb42b29a8fffdf52b4af3a043c6326
Closes-Bug: #1754360

now we don't support to update a policy of the group.

commit_message:
Refactor policies to policy in InstanceGroup DB model

A group can only have 1 policy associated it, but now we have
ONE to MANY model in group model, this patch change it to ONE
to ONE Model.

We also adapt create method to new model, and remove policy
update support in group.save because now we don't support to
update a policy of the group.

Related to blueprint complex-anti-affinity-policies

Change-Id: I95eb1c8470a567408696132ae656305be53dc5bb

[{'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2017-08-25 07:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26740, 'date': '2017-08-25 08:02:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Each test case tests specific method: either list or show.

So, you're breaking single responsibility principle here."}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2017-08-25 08:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Each test case tests specific method: either list or show.
 > 
 > So, you're breaking single responsibility principle here.

Thanks Rafal, it's true that this will break some kind of "single responsibility principle",  but everything is a tradeoff,
if we absolutely only test one api in one testcase, then the count of testcases will increate too quickly.
So we have many testcases like:
test_create_list_show_delete_interfaces
test_role_create_update_show_list
test_group_type_create_list_show
test_create_show_list_update_delete_router
and so on'}, {'account_id': 26740, 'date': '2017-08-25 08:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

commit_message:
Merge volume message list and show testcases

test_list_messages and test_show_message create a volume
type and a volume respectively which is not necessary,
in other words, they can share a volume type and volume
and message, so we can spare one create_volume_type and
one create_volume.

We can either create a volume type and a volume in
resource_setup for sharing usage, or to merge test_list_messages
and test_show_message, but since UserMessagesTest uses
min_microversion which can only have effect after setUp,
that means we can't call list_messages in resource_setup,
so this is to merge list and show into one testcase.

Change-Id: I68fa98697dfb74ec16e4bdb970bad6737817e70b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-30 22:44:13.000000000', 'message': "Fall back to the legacy auth_uri option

In before, we switched from 'auth_uri' to 'www_authenticate_uri' [1]
in a backward-incompatible way, which breaks the legacy setup.
For example, if users install Zun with Pike or earlier version
of OpenStack, it will break.

This patch fixes it by fall back to the legacy option 'auth_uri'
if 'www_authenticate_uri' is not presented. In addition, a unnecessary
import_opt statement is removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568457/

Change-Id: I5e3535f8dbfac73e56190442a31943ac22562ffb
"}]
commit_message:
Fall back to the legacy auth_uri option

In before, we switched from 'auth_uri' to 'www_authenticate_uri' [1]
in a backward-incompatible way, which breaks the legacy setup.
For example, if users install Zun with Pike or earlier version
of OpenStack, it will break.

This patch fixes it by fall back to the legacy option 'auth_uri'
if 'www_authenticate_uri' is not presented. In addition, a unnecessary
import_opt statement is removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568457/

Change-Id: I5e3535f8dbfac73e56190442a31943ac22562ffb

commit_message:
Switch keystone session in glanceclient

We are using keystone session to construct a neutron/cinder client.
This patch align it with glancecleint. As a result, the codebase
is easier to maintain.

Change-Id: I66b53b834fb02945089b0b2acb8e38ae4e94924f

commit_message:
Fix RBD incremental backup

Since the default get_backup_device method doesn't
return enough Ceph connection information, RBD
incremental backup will fail, resulting in full backups
being performed when an incremental is requested.

Closes-Bug: #1578036
Co-Author: Gorka Eguileor <geguileo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I41d1ec84db58f4bf0f7362cec022f2c3380e5ee2
(cherry picked from commit 53522164dc11a1f8316de4cf023abfa113d35704)
Conflicts:
	cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py
