[{'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-25 02:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-25 06:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-25 08:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-06-25 10:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-06-25 11:07:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

@doug

were there any other updates since the python 3 forum session on how we
handle python 3.6 as a community. was it agreed to be added as a community wide goal? if i remember correctly the intent was to be something like the following, python3 first in stien python3 only for new projects in T and python 3 only for U. I would personally prefer to be python 3 only in T but that's just me.

@vu cong tuan
+1 until gate starts passing.
i dont see how your change could have caused the issue
but it will still need to be green for zuul to merge it."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> @doug
 > 
 > were there any other updates since the python 3 forum session on
 > how we
 > handle python 3.6 as a community. was it agreed to be added as a
 > community wide goal? if i remember correctly the intent was to be
 > something like the following, python3 first in stien python3 only
 > for new projects in T and python 3 only for U. I would personally
 > prefer to be python 3 only in T but that's just me.

We aren't really following Canonical's transition plan because Ubuntu is not the only platform we formally support. The agreement was we would allow project teams to drop python 2 support starting in U because that would give our supported distros time to have python 3 support in place. That decision and a more detailed timeline are documented at https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html

Adding 3.6 jobs is part of the python3-first goal (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/) but this patch doesn't do that. It just adds a new section to the tox file to enable those tests to be run. You could avoid needing that if you add the commands entry to the testenv block because the pyXY environments are created automatically and inherit the settings from testenv.

If you want to continue to add environments explicitly, this patch looks OK and should have no effect on your gate until the relevant jobs are added. Adding the gate jobs now would be OK, but will make the job migration work described in the goal patch more complicated because you will want to only add the job on master now and that means dealing with branch specifiers as part of the migration."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-06-25 13:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

thanks doug,
the goal documentation was exactly and python 2 deprecation timelines
were exectly the resouces i was looking for.

i think adding the test env makes sense for those that want to run it mannually.i also agree that while we could add a job i would prefer not to or at least make it non voting until we decide on what the minium version of python will be in U. 

the job can be done in a seperate patch that depends on the intoduction of the new template
proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/6/goals/stein/python3-first.rst 

looking at point 7 in the python3 first doc it would be 3.6 however 
i would like to get clarification on if we also are going to supprot older verions of python 3 and gate on them effectively meaning that while we could run on python 3.6 we may only be able to use features form 3.4 or 3.5'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-26 01:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-26 01:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Thank you very much for your comments with lots of details.
Have a great day ahead.'}, {'account_id': 25903, 'date': '2018-06-26 04:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary pyNN testenv sections

According to [1], the pyNN factors automatically set basepython
unless explicitly requested otherwise.
This patch moves 'commands' attribute up into the 'testenv' section,
"testenv:pyNN" sections are unnecessary and also should be removed.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/477

Change-Id: I535188debcf89c91c887d0026bbf2157333ae2a4

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ifbcb65237598b99224768a47c18b30473c2eaa3e

[{'account_id': 28419, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:07:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 13:06:49.000000000', 'message': "Signed-off-by: Rafal Pietrzak <rafal.pietrzak@pl.ibm.com>
Author: Rafal Pietrzak <rafal.pietrzak@pl.ibm.com>

  Adding support for the octavia listener X-Forwarded-Proto header insertion.
  A X-Forwarded-Proto header is inserted into the end of request to the backend
  member that specifies the string provided - http or https:

  Adding X-Forwarded-Proto to the list of HTTP headers which are supported.

  File: octavia/master/octavia/octavia/common/constants.py:
      SUPPORTED_HTTP_HEADERS = ['X-Forwarded-For',
                                'X-Forwarded-Port',
                                'X-Forwarded-Proto']

  Adding the lines to the macros.j2 realizing the the http/https insertion
  to the backend member.

  File:  octavia/common/jinja/haproxy/templates/macros.j2

        {% if listener.insert_headers.get('X-Forwarded-Proto',
                                       'False').lower() == 'https' %}
    reqadd X-Forwarded-Proto:\ https
        {% endif %}
        {% if listener.insert_headers.get('X-Forwarded-Proto',
                                        'False').lower() == 'http' %}
    reqadd X-Forwarded-Proto:\ http
        {% endif %}

Change-Id: Id017bb277eebae98f0441663e41d07b40b6e3e38
Story: 2002173
Task: 20038

"}, {'created': '2018-06-07 21:02:16.000000000', 'message': "Adding support for the octavia listener X-Forwarded-Proto header insertion.

  Adding support for the octavia listener X-Forwarded-Proto header insertion.
  A X-Forwarded-Proto header is inserted into the end of request to the backend
  member. HTTP for the HTTP listener protocol type, HTTPS for
  the TERMINATED_HTTPS listener protocol type.

  Adding X-Forwarded-Proto to the list of HTTP headers which are supported.

  File: octavia/master/octavia/octavia/common/constants.py:
      SUPPORTED_HTTP_HEADERS = ['X-Forwarded-For',
                                'X-Forwarded-Port',
                                'X-Forwarded-Proto']

  Adding the lines to the macros.j2 realizing the the http/https insertion
  to the backend member according to listener protocol type:

  File:  octavia/common/jinja/haproxy/templates/macros.j2

    {% if (listener.protocol.lower() == constants.PROTOCOL_HTTP.lower()) %}
        {% if listener.insert_headers.get('X-Forwarded-Proto',
                                          'False').lower() == 'true' %}
    reqadd X-Forwarded-Proto:\ http
        {% endif %}
    {% endif %}
    {% if (listener.protocol.lower() ==
           constants.PROTOCOL_TERMINATED_HTTPS.lower()) %}
        {% if listener.insert_headers.get('X-Forwarded-Proto',
                                          'False').lower() == 'true' %}
    reqadd X-Forwarded-Proto:\ https
        {% endif %}
    {% endif %}

Change-Id: Id017bb277eebae98f0441663e41d07b40b6e3e38
Story: 2002173
Task: 20038

commit_message:
Adding support for the octavia listener X-Forwarded-Proto header insertion.

  Adding support for the octavia listener X-Forwarded-Proto header insertion.
  A X-Forwarded-Proto header is inserted into the end of request to the backend
  member. HTTP for the HTTP listener protocol type, HTTPS for
  the TERMINATED_HTTPS listener protocol type.

  Adding X-Forwarded-Proto to the list of HTTP headers which are supported.

  File: octavia/master/octavia/octavia/common/constants.py:
      SUPPORTED_HTTP_HEADERS = ['X-Forwarded-For',
                                'X-Forwarded-Port',
                                'X-Forwarded-Proto']

  Adding the lines to the macros.j2 realizing the the http/https insertion
  to the backend member according to listener protocol type:

  File:  octavia/common/jinja/haproxy/templates/macros.j2

    {% if listener.insert_headers.get('X-Forwarded-Proto',
                                          'False').lower() == 'true' %}
        {% if listener.protocol.lower() == constants.PROTOCOL_HTTP.lower() %}
    http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http
        {% elif listener.protocol.lower() ==
                               constants.PROTOCOL_TERMINATED_HTTPS.lower() %}
    http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https
        {% endif %}
    {% endif %}

Change-Id: Id017bb277eebae98f0441663e41d07b40b6e3e38
Story: 2002173
Task: 20038

commit_message:
FFU: missing ironic tasks

Add database migrations and online data migrations (from Pike on).
Also upgrade packages for both API and conductor (they can be on
different roles).

Closes-Bug: #1780116
Change-Id: I24d20fad72ce29fd3c2c4a96f1ee8422d3e1bdc3
(cherry picked from commit 8cb66f6a4e501e34d765ee87a005f512b2f1832b)
